Due to a food allergy, the bartender researched some of the ingredients to determine if they were safe for me which was above and beyond expectations. The bar experience was a solid 5 stars. Dinner was tasty, service was just right (cheers!) and the atmosphere was relaxed for a white tablecloth kinda place. I guess I would have given this a 5 star rating if our food was as amazing as other Indian restaurants I've been to. That being said, this is a solid, although not "value priced" ($100 for papadam, the jackfruit appetizer, tandoori chicken, naan, aloo gobi, 2 drinks - one w/o liquor - and tip), dinner option. Maybe not so bad considering we brought home leftovers for one of us to have for lunch. 4.5 stars overall.
author: Robin N.

description:
Indian food at its finest! 

The Ala carte prices are high, but the quality and presentation of the food is top notch. I live in Hawaii but whenever I'm anywhere close to SF, I make it a point to stop here. I've never had the buffet because the dishes I like aren't included on the buffet. Maybe next time I come back, I'll try the buffet because it looked amazing too.

Last night we brought the kids for the first time and they also enjoyed the food. My daughter guzzled two mango lassi all by herself. My son enjoyed the butter chicken a LOT, and my sister said it was the best butter chicken she's had in the city. We ordered a bunch of dishes and they were all good!

PALAK CHAAT: crispy spinach appetizer. Super good.
BUTTER CHICKEN: signature dish. We got two @$23 each order! Get this!
LAMB CHOP: bone in, tender chops. Very good!
CHILI SPICED SEA BASS: WOW. Super pricey ($30) but really good! Get this if you like sea bass! 
BIRYANI: comes in a neat puff pastry type of dish, which keeps the rice moist.
ALOO GOBI: good but I'll skip it next time

Man we ate so much food I could barely walk up the steps to get out! I definitely had a food baby in my belly after that meal. So good! Can't wait to come back!
author: Lori I.

description:
I was very disappointed with this place. My boyfriend is on a very strict diet where he cannot have certain things that are common in Indian food, so I called the host and made sure that they had dishes that he could have. The host named a few so we went for dinner. 
 When we got there, the server said that he couldn't eat any of the dishes that the host suggested because they all had the ingredients he needed to avoid, so he ended up having to order daal (lentil soup) for $17 which actually ended up having tomatoes that he needed to avoid. 

My brother and I ordered chicken tikka and a lamb curry. The lamb was what the server highly recommended and after one bite, neither my brother or I could eat it. It tasted like rubber because it was overcooked and it must have been old too because they brought it out way too quickly after we ordered. When we told the server, he rudely replied "it's cooked fine" and gave a mean chuckle. 

When we got the bill, we noticed that he had already added gratuity to it even though we were just a small party of three. 

The samosas were good, but all in all it was definitely the worst Indian restaurant I've been to.
author: Nicki K.

description: This is My favorite place to get Indian food. It cost more than other Indian restaurants but well worth it. Can't go wrong with the butter chicken and chicken tika masala. The environment is nice, they have a nice bar and the service and food was amazing.
author: Kassie C.

description: It was a pathetic experience with the guy (couldn't get his name, but he has a beard) who received us. We were a team of 12 and he initially made us sit in a couple of small round tables which were hardly sufficient for us. When we requested to check for any alternate table, this guy was very rude.. and he was like "this is the only table available, all others are taken!!" We understand that, but the least he could do is to say this patiently. Very poor customer service! Somehow we had to continue for namesake due to time constraint, even when the entire team was pissed off.. this restaurant screwed up the entire lunch experience!
author: Aravinth B.

description: I went there for lunch on a weekday with my coworkers and had a great experience. We had the lunch buffet and all the dishes were delicious I actually think this might be my favorite Indian restaurant in San Francisco it is a little expensive but it is totally worth it the ambience is also very nice during the night it actually looks pretty amazing especially the lights the service was good and the wait wasn't too long especially if you have a reservation the line for the buffet does get a little long I think there is plenty of seats but if you are a big team then you should definitely make a reservation in advance The highlight was definitely the food quality I've been mostly disappointed by the Indian restaurants in San Francisco but I think this one would really satisfy your taste buds I think they also have fancy drinks the desserts were good to overall a great experience
author: Arjan N.

description:
Me and some co-workers came for dinner last night and we had a blast! We enjoyed their starters such as their freshly crisp samosas, and tender chicken on naan.

For our entrees, we shared flavorful types of naan (garlic and pesto), creamy butter chicken, truffle chicken tikka,tandoori smapler which I enjoyed each one especially the lamb seekh! We also had mang lassi which was freshly tasting. It had enough sweetness to it and the right creamy-smoothie texture. 

Their service is quick and very attentive which is always a plus.

I'd defintely come back for more! This is a great place to come with friends after a good night of drinking or a place to come and have some great Indian food. My friends and I had a great time overall and we just enjoyed the food to the max.
author: Allister D.

description:
This is one of the BEST Indian Restaurants in the city. 
Service is very attentive, food is amazing and the mimosas are bottomless (Weekends only I think) . 
 The brunch buffet will change your life.
author: Kate P.

description:
Food is wicked. Ambience is good. Defs got extra spice to it. Had a business dinner here, service was great and pretty reasonable for SF for its location and ambience. 

I had aloo gobi and I tend to have aloo gobi and chana masala at all Indian restaurants I go to. This one, I loved. There was so much food that I couldn't finish. 

Despite having a table of 13 people come in, they were able to sit me rather quickly and even when the other party was late, they were just very patient and understanding. 

I'll be going back.
author: Christine H.

description:
We are an Indian family of foodies and were looking for a place with decent Indian dinner in SF. Amber turned out to be way better than our expectation and had authentic flavors. Their bhindi jaipuri (okra) and chicken biryani were bang on, in terms of taste and texture.
I would recommend this place for delicious Indian meal with a cozy ambience. The drink menu is great!
author: Avanti S.

description: The food here is outstanding.  A little pricey but not egregious.  Butter chicken is outstanding, and so is the lamb vindaloo and the garlic Naan bread. You won't go wrong at Amber.
author: Hansang B.

description: Great food- a bit pricey! Attentive staff! Good bar to get a drink! Great location near Powell BART.
author: S M.

description: Such a poor value for the overpriced food means I can't give this place higher than two stars. $20-$30 for a dish the size of a yarmulke, are you high??!
author: Justin S.

description: I got the famous butter chicken and it was ok. Definitely overpriced for what you get. I can get better Indian food 5 other places in this area. The ambience of the place is nice.
author: Ryan A.

description:
Came here for their lunch buffet and it is upscale Indian cuisine dining.  

I love their gamey goat curry, butter chicken curry and chicken wings!  They had good vegetarian entrees too, such as their cabbage salad and mushroom platter.  Their yogurt and mint sauce, complimented well with their flavorful curry that is rich with spices.  I used the naan to dip that nice sauce altogether. 

Upon entering, their bar lounge is quite cozy and they offer happy hour.  

Ambiance and staffing was great.  They often came around to refill water, picked up the plates and asked if we needed anything else.

I had food coma spell afterwards, surely.
author: Tiffany D.

description: Cute bar/restaurant, nice crowd, cool looking bar, yummy Indian eats, love the samosas but the service was very slow. An appetizer took almost half an hour. Maybe just an off night. Also felt it's a bit overpriced for the food portions. Perhaps I need to try other dishes.
author: P S.

description:
One of the worst restaurants I have been here in the US. I don't know how it got so many good reviews , but we had horrendous experience here last night.
Very decorated fake names of dishes in the menu, and the dish served is entirely different. We ordered Zafran pulao and what we got is leftover/yesterday's rice, cauliflower manchuriaon with simply raw cauliflower in it, murgh lukhonwai had half cooked chicken pieces , cheese chilli naan had no signs of chilli and salt, and cheese was very smartly replaced by leftover panner. They are charging way too much just because they are in downtown, and do not have any decent chef's employed in their kitchen.
Never ever go to this restaurant.
author: Abhishek C.

description:
Let me start off by saying that service and food were freaking amazing!!!!!!

We walked in starved after shopping with no reservations and thankfully they had a great table.  

I literally can't wait to be back in the City to come here for dinner!  My mouth is salivating at the thought...

Our favorites:

- Samosa
- Truffled Chicken Tikka - we asked for this extra spicy..hella good
- Tandoori Chicken - extra spicy - I wish my stomach would expand to infinite measures and I would have wolfed down this entire dish lol
- Bhindi Jaipuri - Okra sauteed fennel, onion, dried mango powder - this hit the spot!
- Assorted bread basket - spinach roti, laccha paratha, naan.  Next time I'd just get the naan instead.
- Zafran Khuska

We will definitely be back and soon!!!!!
author: Veronica A.

description:
I like their food especially the chicken biryani but have noticed the following:

1) the Chilean sea bass used to come with 4 pieces- now it comes with 3 pieces. The price also changed from $26 to $37 for one less piece!

2) the seas bass flavor has changed substantially- it is breaded now and doesn't taste as good

3) as a compensation for the less piece of fish, there is a side of quinoa and a small papadum to fill the plate

Please bring back the original 4 pieced sea bass- thank you
author: Michele Y.

description:
RIPOFF
I am surprised by the good reviews and I think those are mostly by non-indian folks. I had guests visiting from Chicago last weekend and we were in SF so planned a nice meal in a group. We selected Amber and it was a disappointment.
The waiter was rude from the start from getting our initial order to getting some additional orders. Then we found out that they cheated on some orders like we ordered 6 naans and he served it only 3 ( cut in traingles) and said those are 6. Since we were 6 adults and 4 kids, since not everyone even got a piece it was easy to see. shocked. cheat on naans? And when we asked him if he indeed served us 6 naans, he says quite rudely, "well, how would I know, the basket is empty and you ate all.". Dood, get another job , may be with United. Will avoid it, given choices we have nearby.
author: Aryan V.

description: Great place! Very close to the conference center and the food is delicious. Dishes are little bit pricy but worth it if you want to have a proper dinner.
author: Minzhi Y.

description:
How to Do Lunch @ Amber India:

1) Go during an off time to avoid the crowds.

2) Head straight to the lunch buffet and find the big vat of tomatoey Butter Chicken deliciousness. It's their signature dish for a reason!

3) Conserve stomach space by ignoring the other dishes. (Rice and naan are ok.)

4) Repeat steps 2 and 3.

5) Hopefully someone else is treating since this upscale lunch buffet will set you back $20 a person.

6) Food coma naptime!
author: Amy C.

description:
Had stopped here for a lunch buffet during a day business trip to SFO. It was quite crowded but the aroma was too good so we decided to wait for a table. We got a table within five minutes and it was totally worth the wait!!
The food was delicious! Starter pakoras fresh and crispy. Cornpalak and paneer sabzi was quite awesome and so was the dal! Naan was super soft and melted in my mouth. Desserts we're quite fulfilling with 3 to 4 variety of well made Indian varieties. The jalebi taste still lingers in my mouth. 
Would never hesitate to go back and next time and recommend this to others
author: Niveditha C.

description: Some of the best butter chicken and paneer tikka I've ever had. The naan was also very good. Service is a bit slow but it was a Sunday so the place was very busy.
author: Connie K.

description: The best Indian food I've ever had! I can not even say that this is an order, or order it, because it's all delicious. Order everything. The restaurant is elegant and modern, very clean and very upscale.
author: Aaliyah P.

description: Ridiculously over priced restaurant. Food items are nowhere close to authentic. I ordered multiple items from the dinner menu and was disappointed with every single one of them. Lachcha paratha was the worst! It is possible to make better lachcha paratha than what they served even by watching youtube tutorial! Portion sizes are really small. Not worth your time or money. Please avoid if you can.
author: Ashu S.

description: I love their food! The ambience is also cool! Go during the happy hour! I took my Indian friend there as she loved the food! Good selection of wine and food. A little pricey hence the 4 stars only.
author: Alex P.

description:
I ordered pickup. 

Order was perfect and ready when they said it would be. 

The workers were friendly. 

My meal (lamb chops and cauliflower side dish) were delicious. Tender and flavorful. 

It was packed with a long wait for reservations so call ahead!
author: Michelle P.

description: Over priced with not a lot of spice. I gave three stars because the drinks were really good and the presentation was beautiful. Still the best Indian food in San Francisco is in the tenderloin on Jones Street. It's a hole in the wall and it's a mess but the flavor they got down pat. I've never paid $130 for Indian food for three dishes two appetizers and two drinks. Sorry Amber I'll be walking to the shady part of town to get my Indian.
author: Roxanne O.

description: Meh. I found the place good but... high price, service hit and miss, food unimaginative on one side and not even that traditional on the other side.
author: Stefano Z.

description:
A co-worker and I came here for lunch and we both had the lunch buffet.  The food was delicious.  Rice, tons of vegetarian dishes, a couple of delicious fried appetizers, goat stew, chicken tandoori, fish, dessert, salad . . . it was sooooo good!  My favorite was the spinach and potato.  

I will be back soon and definitely recommend.
author: Cari N.

description: Good food... my advice to people who it spicy "do not  order paneer skewewrs .. it's testless and not worth of spending $21.. it not even similar to paneer chilly . My rest of the food was amazing ... loved it . Would recommend this friends and family ...
author: Krupa P.

description: I have been here for buffet and the food was delicious. It is definitely superior in taste and quality to many other Indian restaurants around. I particularly find the butter chicken, garlic naan, gajar halwa and pakoras very delicious. The service is pretty good too. Taste has been pretty consistent over several visits.
author: Tejashree M.

description: Came here for Valentine's Day with my wife and had a great experience. Everything was really delicious and service was attentive. Ambience and location are top notch in SF. We had pretty standard samosas and butter chicken, but also ordered Lobster curry that was to die for, could have eaten it like soup. This is a cant miss if you want Indian in SF downtown.
author: Jordan S.

description:
If I was rating Amber just on its food I would give the restaurant 4 stars for above average quality but not the best I have had. Amber gets 5 stars for having exceptional service along with its above average food!

I came here to try out their lunch buffet. The buffet was around $20 which is a bit expensive for a lunch buffet so I was expecting an over the top lunch selection to choose from. I would have liked more kick with the spiced fish but the rest of their selection was outstanding. It was nice to see my favorite dish, chicken biriyani, as one of the selections and made perfectly. The selection size was decent but I did expect more. Their dessert selection was better than the average Indian buffet though. 

Lastly the service was outstanding here. The staff was friendly, efficient, and attentive.

I arrived at around 11:50 for lunch and it looked like I was one of the first to arrive but by 12:15 there was about a 20 person line for the buffet. There was a mixed bag of individuals which is great to see for an Indian restaurant!
author: Aswin K.

description: Very nice trendy spot in San Fran. The food was delish and they had some new twists that I'm sure u won't find elsewhere
author: Jess H.

description:
Located in Yerba Buena Lane (pedestrian walkway) - parking is difficult but it is near multiple MUNI stops + BART. There is a separate bar area, with two large dining areas. Also a private dining room for larger parties. 

Service is decent - after an initial lag.. our server kept checking up on us and was helpful with her recommendations. 

I'm not the biggest fan of Indian, but I came here with my Indian-food fanatic coworkers, who knew just what to order. 
-Samosas (4/5): YUM! Crispy exterior with mushy, yummy inside.
-Malabari shrimp (3/5): Really good but -2 for the shrimp being super tiny, and only a few of them at that price?! No no. 
-Butter chicken (5/5): SO good. Creamy and flavorful goodness.
-Roti (3/5): Very salty (no idea if that's the way to make this? but it's still unbearably salty)
-Laccha Paratha (4/5): Loved the seasoning on this, more so than the plane naan!

If you're looking for a gourmet Indian dinner, Amber India will be your spot!
author: Shelley K.

description: Good ambience, food was good as well but not exquisite as I would have expected. Was looking for more finesse in the quality of food and presentation
author: Himanshu V.

description: Really neat bar area! Loved the uplighting/wall of colorful light. The meal was delicious! I really enjoyed my experience.
author: K F.

description: I have to say, although the food is priced high, it is really good. Their buffet is good with a lot of options for both vegetarian and non-vegetarians.
author: Hemant J.

description:
Wanted to go out for some sort of meal I'd pay more than $50 for.

As a safe route, I chose Indian food.

I was NOT disappointed at all!

The options on the menu were very diverse, extremely creative. Ultimately settled on a lobster dish from the clay pot options and the butter chicken. Both were GREAT!

I eat Indian food a lot. Like, obsessively. It makes up around 1/3 - 2/3 of my daily diet. That's how obsessive I am. I therefore tend towards eating a lot of butter chicken.

This butter chicken still managed to blow my mind! The chicken was perfectly tender, and the sauce had just the right balance of tomato-ness and creaminess.

The lobster didn't have that annoying overpowering lobster taste. You could really taste all the spices!

The dessert was also really good. I got the molten chocolate cake with ice cream. The cake was just sweet enough! I loved it.

Overall, I recommend this place if you feel like getting an expensive meal of some sort.
author: Gabriel R.

description:
I wanted to give this place a higher rating but it was just okay. I went in with extremely high expectations, "best Indian restaurant" in the city I was told.  I finally had dinner at Amber India this past weekend and it was a lovely experience but it didn't make it on my favorite places to dine list. Let's start with the most essential part, the food.

Food:
Malabar Shrimp Gluten Free          14
Sauteed Monterey bay shrimp, coconut and spices

Butter Chicken Gluten Free             24
Amber's signature-shredded tandoori chicken, tomato, cream sauce

Cucumber Raita Gluten Free            7
Churned yogurt, English cucumber

Naan    4.5
Side Rice   5

Total ~ around 80 for two of us.

The food was good, not spectacular, just good. It was a pleasing meal but I would not label this restaurant as the best Indian spot in San Francisco. The portions were pretty average for a higher end restaurant such as Amber India. The chicken was flavorful, not too spicy, and very tender. The rice was pretty standard along with the naan and roti. The Cucumber Raita stood out the most to be, it was my favorite thing on the table. 

Service:
I was in between giving this place a 3 or a 4, mainly because of the service. If there's one thing that I value when eating out, it's exceptional customer service. Amber India provided that for me. Our server was very polite and attentive to our needs. The bussers were also super attentive. 

Atmosphere:
Amber India has such a beautiful atmosphere, but again this is more of an upscale restaurant so it should. Not meaning to be entirely superficial, but one of the reasons why I wanted to check this place out was for their interior décor and design. It would be a good spot for a date; though to my surprise, there were lots of families with kids (found that a tad bit random since we were having dinner during prime time on a Saturday night). Nothing wrong with kids, just found it interesting to see so many families in a fairly upscale Downtown SF restaurant on a weekend night. Tables here do seem to be quite close to each other, luckily we were able to get a more isolate table. 

Overall, I'd give Amber India a 3.5!
author: Stefany Z.

description: My experience in amber was so much exiting one. All the dishes I had was simply awesome. The taste and aroma of each curries are unable to explain. This one is my favourite Indian restaurant so far in SF.
author: Gibu G.

description:
Too long a line at another restaurant had opportunity leading me to Amber. For a Monday evening, the space was full, and there would have been a thirty minute wait for a table, but bar seating for one was immediate. I had my own window with a view of the fancy buildings on Market Street. 

The server took a bit to find me, but I had my order ready, and had a tolerable wait for my meal. The ambiance was nice, if noisy, but the food was some of the most well balanced Indian I have had in the last few years of travel across the US. The spices were layered, with no one thing annihilating your senses, the heat built to tolerable levels and faded away while you enjoyed there flaky and chewy assortment of naan (garlic and chive!) and the portions were generous--enough that I took home leftovers. 

The wait to pay the check took a bit as well, but I'll still let me coworkers know to stop at Amber when they are in town.
author: April B.

description:
I don't think many of the restaurants in soma/Yerba Burma evoke the same "homey" feel as other less commercial places in the city, but the bar/lounge area at Amber is tucked away and an often forgotten happy hour spot. 

I used to be a regular here. The prices aren't exactly a bargain but you can fill up on all the apps. I've tried most items on the HH menu. My favorite dish is this pulled chicken in a masala type sauce they put on top of a deliciously light and buttery bread. I wish I could remember the name of the dish but couldn't find it on the online menu :(. I never thought the cocktails were "great" and stuck to the wine list. The bartender remembered us after being there a couple of times which is always nice.

Overall a solid spot for drinks and tasty food after a day of work.
author: Christine M.

description:
I want to give this place five stars because I absolutely love it but honestly a huge issue I have with this place is the seating. For such a beautiful, elegant place, the seating is so crowded. It was difficult trying to get through just to get to the bathroom. Also, don't expect to be able to talk about private matters because people in the next table would be able to hear. 

Anyways, besides that.... 
The food was so good! 

I had the tandoori chicken, pan bread thingy, & avocado scallops plate. I've had better nan. It wasn't as soft as I'm used to but the other dishes were tasteful. 

The decor was gorgeous and I kept commenting at how beautiful the restaurant was. 

And the service was excellent!
author: Jill H.

description:
+ Good ambiance 
+ Great Biryani & Salan
+ Good service

- lil pricey 
- Their bar is closed at times
author: Jaimini P.

description:
Fantastic Indian find that has a bill of fare that runs the gamut from chicken tikka masala to samosas. The curries are straight-up, textbook North Indian, but are devoid of grease/creams and yet heavy on the flavour, both of which are wins for me. Look for some more fusiony fare options if you're eager to explore. Elegant digs, definitely in the $$$ range, but you'll find it's truly satisfying and quick on service.

* DRK - Torrontes and Viognier as both varietals were rare finds and excellent options at the price point (FYI - sweeter whites perfectly tempered the extra spicy dishes we requested)
* APP (well...) - No papads served here? We were surprised. And disappointed as that's classic Indian app no matter where you go. 
* GET - Kadahi Paneer and Saag Paneer and both were cooked very English style; spices that weren't fiery but had a bite, blended to perfection, non-greasy, and just yum enough for us to come back a second next. Paneer in both is creamy and high in moisture, not rubbery or dry like you may find at a fast food Desi joint.
* GET - Garlic Chive Naan, which had light flakes of both instead of chopped pieces falling all over the plate

* YES - Spacious seating (both in the elegant red-tinged bar and the restaurant (though taller folks like yours truly ought to sit on the seated not couchy side as I was slumped so low I wanted to ask for a booster seat)
* YES - Friendly hostess and waiter service
* YES - Good for groups and dates

* FYI - Takes reservations
* FYI - Accepts credit cards
* FYI - Half sizes of some of the entrees are available depending upon your order. Just ask.
author: Navissima K.

description:
Amber is a nice safe option in the Yerba Buena area. I went on a first date here and we ordered Samosas, Butter Chicken, Garlic Chive Naan, and Mango Lassi. The total came out to about $65; certainly not inexpensive but also not as bad as some other spots in the area.

We walked in at 6pm with no reservations and were seated in the lower dining room area. The wine list was provided on an iPad but we were both recovering from a weekend of drinking and wine was the last thing on our mind. My date convinced me that one entree would be enough for the two of us and it was, only because he didn't eat very much of it.

The food was delicious and I enjoyed all of it. I'm sure there are better Indian restaurants in SF and I'll probably try another place next time.
author: Yi Z.

description: Great ambience, great food , consistent quality . Very authentic North Indian food . Ambience is always very good. Very friendly staff
author: Sonny S.

description:
We went for the weekend buffet today. Our party had 4 adults, 3 kids, aged 13, 11 and 6. We were seated at a booth quickly. The buffet had a decent selection with a complimentary drink. The food looked good and they also had a live dosa station. We ate the food, but all of us were pretty full after eating one plate, and no, we didn't pile all our food in it. 

We paid the bill. I was surprised to see that we were charged for 7 full buffets. Come on, $26.95 for a 6 year old??? Sadly, I didn't notice it till I got back home. To top it off, they charged the gratuity on a buffet. I would have left some, but didn't like the idea of being forced to pay it for a buffet. Frankly, I would have been okay with it, if we hadn't had indigestion afterwards. Every single person in our party today didn't have dinner, as we are still full. And no, we did not stuff ourselves. I ate much less than I would if I had gone to a normal restaurant. 

I have been to the this place before, but this time the quality of food sucked. Needless to say, I am never ever going back. We ended up spending around $250 bucks for stomach ache, ahhhhh. I wish we had gone somewhere else.
author: Asha N.

description: Bad service, our waiter Dan immediately treated us less than when the 4 of us didn't order cocktails. Asked if we could have chicken korma instead of lamb and he didn't even audibly say no he just shook his head. Any Indian place I've been to and asked to sub a meat they were always happy to oblige. When we didn't order cocktails he brought us a non alcoholic drink list. We all agreed that he made all of us feel uncomfortable every time he came to the table. To spend that sort of money for curries and to be treated so weirdly, makes me absolutely sure I would never go back.
author: Megan T.

description:
200th review... Yay! I'll make this quick since there isn't much else to say besides Amber India was brilliant! I went with my lunch group during CM week and was so surprised by how cute and big it was on the inside. From the outside, you certainly can't tell how much it has going on on the inside. Now, I can only speak on the lunch buffet, since that's what we had. The butter chicken was the best I've ever had. I don't know if this is possible, but it had a slight vinegar-y taste to it that took it over the top. Everything else I had was great as well. The rice was cooked perfectly as were the vegetables. Only critique that I have is that the naan was not very good at all. It's like they put a ton of effort into the actual food and then don't have any time or energy to put into the bread.

Can't win 'em all!
author: Lauri W.

description: The food here is incredible! However i have to dock them a few stars based on the hours they open and the delivery service (Doordash) they use! After two hours of waiting for our food, which was ready per the restaurant, we had to cancel our order! We were so looking forward to Indian and neither my husband nor I ate lunch knowing we would eat an early and delicious dinner! Amber REALLY needs to connect with a new delivery service because until they do we will no longer be customers of them!
author: Melanie B.

description: I have been here multiple times for both the lunch buffet and dinner. Its a good (but expensive) spot for north Indian food. The palak chat is a must have. I also like their kofta, butter chicken, dal makhani and mirch salan.
author: Arvind M.

description:
Awesome fancy Indian place in the Union Square area. My friend and I shared the butter chicken and saag paneer with naan and rice. The butter chicken was very good and the saag paneer was so rich and creamy--some of the best I've ever had. My friend also ordered a mango lassi and she was a fan. The portions looked a bit on the smaller side when they came out, so to my surprise we were full after eating just 75% of the food (and we came in pretty hungry). Great for dinner; would love to come back and try other items on the menu. 

Taste | 5
Atmosphere | 5
Presentation | 4
Service | 4
OVERALL | 4.5
author: Lana L.

description:
This has to be my favorite restaurant. My trip to SF is incomplete without indulging in their exquisite cuisine. Unlike other Indian restaurants, they continue to surprise me with their menu. This time it was Pudina tikki, frontier lamb chops , saag paneer and murgh kaalimirch/ each dish unique and flavorful. 
Made a reservation for 9:30 , arrived early and was seated right away. Wonderful ambience and crowd. 
Don't pass them by- visit this place - you won't be disappointed.
author: Ashu R.

description:
We love Indian food but it's difficult to find a place with great Indian food and ambience. Amber has both.

Dimly lit, romantic atmosphere. Friendly service. We started with samosas and they were flaky and crisp, with wonderful flavor! I chose the seabass with a coconut curry sauce and my boyfriend had the butter chicken. We ordered saag paneer to accompany the dishes. My fish was a little "fishy" but the sauce was nice... we both enjoyed the chicken and saag. The warm naan with raita was perfect. 

It is a bit pricey, but I would recommend.
author: Jennifer C.

description: The guys at reception are super rude. While booking reservation they just say there are no reservations available and bang the phone. After going there as week you don't get treated well. I tried to take my friends from India their twice. Got very disappointed in the entire process of booking reservations here.
author: Abhishek G.

description:
Visited here for the lunch buffet, which was a very good deal for the price (less than $20/person). Choices of food is slightly limited for a buffet, but there was a fair amount of food choices, including salad, rice, some meats and vegetables, and dessert/fruit. The butter chicken and goat were both delicious, and there was also some fish, but butter chicken definitely outshines the other dishes. There was also naan provided at the table.

Seating is a bit crowded, especially for people who come for the lunch buffet, but the decor was nice (albeit a bit dark in certain areas) and clean. My main gripe is where the buffet is set up - it's kind of awkwardly placed, without much room for people to line up, and it wraps around these pillars just inside the entrance. In general, it was kind of confusing and I only knew where to go by following other people in my group. 

Overall, the food was pretty good and the waiters were very attentive, making sure to come around and take away used plates and refill water/drinks. If you're a big group, make sure to make a reservation! They are conveniently located just steps away from Powell Bart, as well as Yerba Buena Gardens. If you come for the lunch buffet, you might go home in a food coma or with a food baby, or both, like I did - just a warning :)
author: Jennifer W.

description: Some of the BEST Indian food I've ever had. Super pricey, so I probably won't be back, but if I were able to afford it I'd eat here on the regular.
author: Paloma L.

description: Beautiful environment. Food that made all of my taste buds jump for joy. Drinks both alcoholic and non alcoholic were delicious!! And awesome service to top the experience off.
author: Kristina F.

description: $20 buffet for lunch. Good selection of food. Don't eat a whole lot of indian food, but i enjoyed it. Good mix of curry, chicken, rices, with different veggies sauces and what not. Worth a try if you are looking to try something different
author: JT H.

description:
I have to admit I'm slightly biased since I'm a sucker for Indian Food.

I got the Butter Chicken (mild) with Garlic Naan, while my friend got the Chicken Briyani with Garlic Naan. I consulted my waitress asking whether or not I should get rice and naan with my Butter Chicken, to which she was very helpful in asking about how hungry I was and offering to bring out rice after I had started my meal.

The Briyani dish is rice inside a shell of bread, which was a substantial amount of food and carbs.

Also, on a side note Amber has Pesto Naan which I'll need to come back and try!
author: Anna M.

description: I stopped by here to grab a quick drink with friends. It was a little after 5pm and the bar was nearly empty. It took about 20 minutes to grab someones attention and get one vodka cranberry. Needless to say, I will not be coming back.
author: Kat N.

description: Absolutely delicious food, reasonable price, walkable from union square. Very pleased with the service as well! They also offer other classic items, such as chicken tikka masala, that are not on the menu. Keep up the amazing work, Amber!!
author: Taylor F.

description: #1. Definitely not for vegans.   #2. Very limited menu, not the usual wide range of foods.  #3. My particular dish was execrable, some sort of jalapenos in a gloopy, tasteless gravy (like gravy for mashed potatoes.  But over jalapenos.) No other vegetables.  Ick.  It's hard to screw up Indian food but this place did it.  #4. Cocktails were good.  #5 Waiter was inattentive and impatient. #6.  Costly.  Overall: #ThisPlaceSucks
author: Mickey M.

description:
Amber, Amber, Amber. So many things I want to say about my favorite Indian restaurant in SF. It hasn't been dethroned yet! First of all, the ambience is very "Amber" and the rooms bathed in a warm glow. Any dish you order here is bound to knock you off your seat. 

I find myself having Amber cravings all the time, and a quick lunch buffet will sometimes satiate it for a week. The Flavors are exquisite and this is truly the epitome of Indian fine dining. 

Must have lamb chops & butter chicken!! I will make any excuse for a trip to Amber.
author: Jovian C.

description: Server are so amazing .. chief is most amazing person.. I was there a week ago and not only the server even food runner and manager do take care of me ..
author: John L.

description: It was really good, good food, butter chicken to die for, fantastic ambiance, excellent service. Very well run! Kudos the The Amber team .
author: Vicky S.

description:
Mad a reservation for Valentine's Day over 2 weeks early. Specifically made the reservation here as they did not have a prix fix menu listed on open table like 95% of the other restaurants on open table. 

They call me THE DAY BEFORE Valentine's Day to tell me that they are only offering a $75 prix fix now. So of course it's too late to find anything else decent. I won't be eating there tomorrow or ever, because of the lack of consideration for your customers.
author: Tamara F.

description:
So this review is solely on the manager Pankaj..this gentleman had the audacity to be outrightly curt and rude, not once, not twice but on every occasion we've visited and he's been there.

The other folks who were helping around were aware of the faux pas on Pankaj's part and assisted us with our needs. 

I give the restaurant a 3 star rating mainly for their decent level of Indian cuisine.
author: KC L.

description: The food is good, but the service is horrible. I arrived 15 min early to my reservation and asked if I could be seated. I got the response "you come when your reservation is." I have no problem waiting but an upscale restaurant should be able to understand how you address your costumers in a polite way. Ruined the whole experience and never coming back.
author: V S.

description: Service and food sucks , used to be great saw a cockroach next to my table, service is horrible the Indian server was eying the female customers rather than serving. What a perverted atmosphere, felt sorry for the female customers, this eyeballing scum, was looking at them as if he was going to rape them.
author: andy g.

description:
We've been to Amber many times. It is pricey. We've tried to find other Indian restaurants that we enjoy at a lower price-point. Unfortunately, when we go elsewhere, we are utterly disappointed and regret not sticking to this place.

Yes, Amber is pricey but they know what they are doing - you certainly get what you pay for. Food is high quality, delicious, and prepared well.

I gave it 5 stars because it's the best Indian food in the city, hands down. There are other Indian restaurants at lower price points that are as good, but none in SF.

If you want (or crave) Indian food in SF, don't think twice, go to Amber. You're guaranteed to have an above average meal every time you go.
author: Gaurav B.

description: The food was AMAZING!!  We took all the recommendations from our waiter Joe and he did not disappoint. Coming from Vegas we love our food. We will definitely come back because of Joe
author: Kimberly A.

description: Chicken Tika Marsala, samosas and freshly made garlic nan. Ok we also ordered a vegetarian and a lamb dish which I could not remember the names. The place is deliciously awesome!!! Their serving sizes are on the smaller side which was perfect for me. The spice level is perfect. The samosas are proportioned specifically as an appetizer and the flavor is authentically Indian. The restaurant ambiance is pretty up scale. The diners seemed to be local folks along with frequent business travelers. I dined here with a couple of friends one of which is from London and is a pretty good Indian food critic - and she was impressed herself! Would definitely recommend!
author: G F.

description:
We were here for a girls' night out 2 nights before Thanksgiving.
Ordered Palak Chat, Paneer Tikka, crispy potato turnover, chili rubbed fish kebab, mixed veg korma.  The Palak Chat as an appetizer was a 
  novel creation.  The fish kebab was moist.  The paneer was a bit sweet --not too authentic.

The ambiance was good for our occasion as the 4 of us were busy talking .

There is nothing outstanding here.
author: Kim N.

description: Service is excellent, food wasn't too bad. The Sunday brunch is pretty good, champagne is provided. Definitely worth a try!
author: Harpal G.

description: Came here to celebrate two birthdays and Father's Day. Mango Mojitos, asparagus wrapped in chicken, Tofu tiki.
author: Sanjay R.

description: Very nice decor & service. The food was good, not great, portions on the small side. They are trying hard to be an upscale restaurant but hey will have to do more to justify their prices.
author: John D.

description: My expectations were pretty high for this restaurant.  My friend highly recommend we eat here.  I enjoyed the food a lot.  It was typical Indian food nothing unique though.  All the food was well prepared.  The food was very good.  The restaurant had a great ambiance and the room in the back is great for large groups of people.  The food is expensive but the restaurant and service is very nice!  The butter chicken was excellent.
author: Abbas B.

description: If you know anything about Desi food, DON'T go to this place!! Totally overpriced for tasteless food. The rice was so dry it could easily had been leftovers from the day before. Just safe your money. Really don't know how this place got so many good reviews, maybe from white folks I guess.
author: Saima S.

description:
My boyfriend and I went to Amber India last week and had a wonderful night. This place has some of the best Indian food in the city! The menu was extensive and everything was delicious. We started off with the shrimp and then split the paneer and butter chicken. Highly recommend the pesto naan. The service was also great- the staff is kind and attentive.

Would highly recommend for date night or a place to take friends/ family when they're in town! Overall, great dining experience and would go again.
author: Charlotte H.

description: Ambiance is great, service is great, food is great. Authentic indian perfect for lunch or happy hour after work.
author: David A.

description: One of the worst places we have had Indian food in the city. None of the vegetarian appetizers were good. Everything tasted coconuty. Sauce in Kadai paneer tasted like South Indian gravy. Saffron rice didn have any hint of saffron in it. Even the ginger ale we ordered was just water. The place is pricey but the food is not even mediocre. Two stars for the friendly/ professional staff.
author: Abby A.

description:
I have eaten many times at Amber and always enjoyed good food.  Today I took a special friend there for the buffet lunch, and after my experience there I will never return and will never recommend Amber to anyone.

First of all, the place was filthy and grimy,  all the glass (or plastic?) shields over the food were so streaked with what appeared to be grease it made the buffet look unappetizing.  The areas around the food were dabbled with spilled food.  The tables were not totally wiped clean.

Second, the buffet offerings were only luke-warm especially the butter chicken.  I had to for 10 minutes for them to replenish the butter chicken.   The naan bread came to the table cold.  Frankly, I can make better tasting Indian food at home from packaged mixes.  

Third, I made our server aware of these problems and he politely ignored me.  I then spoke to a tall fellow who appeared to be a manager and listed my complaints and all he could say was "we have been very busy."  Never offered to have things corrected, or reduce the bill.

I contemplated not leaving a tip, but the servers (who were very scarce) more or less did their job.

What a shame, another San Francisco restaurant that has not taken itself for granted, and simply does not keep up their standards.
author: Donald J.

description: Was a pleasant experience . We're there for lunch buffet . Good food but a bit at upper price spectrum .
author: Amir H.

description: Great vegetarian food, - avoid the starters as they were slightly disappointing. On the whole a great meal as there was good cocktails and wonderful service. Reasonably priced for the type of place it is. The quantity is upto standard. A good place for a date night!
author: Misha M.

description:
I have to divide this review in 2 parts: 1) the AYCE buffet and 2) the non-buffet dinner experience. 

For both the buffet and dinner experience, there's some commonality: the food was fantastic and the ambience is great. The service is top-notch, and Amber does an outstanding job at putting a modern spin on traditional Indian cuisine.

For the dinner experience, I'd give it 3 stars. We had the aloo ghobhi, chicken tikka, tandoori chicken, fried calamari, and garlic naan. The preparation, spice balance, and presentation were great. I give it 3-stars because it was pricey compared to the quantity of food you get and the fact that this is one of those restaurants that makes every diner pay for the health benefits of the employees, which I think is a questionable practice. So when you factor in the food cost, tax, tip and health benefits of the employees, the price can get exorbitant quickly.

I'd give the buffet 4 stars. Again, the food quality and ambience are great. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because there wasn't a large variety of food offerings. Maybe something has changed since I was last there and there's more food available at the buffet now.
author: Charles A.

description: Nice place for an indian dinner on market street. Loved the ambience. Food pretty tasty but nothing exotic! Palak chaat was recommended on every review, but was most disappointing! It was just fried palak and some chaat masala! Entrees were decebt though. Pricy place but good for an ocassion or celebration!
author: Divya C.

description: Unfortunately, I was not overly impressed. I've had as good, if not better, Indian food, for much less, in Los Angeles. However the restaurant decor is very attractive and the wait staff were very pleasant.
author: Moe B.

description:
Excellent Indian but it comes at a price.
Ambience: Several areas to sit - bar, lounge or more conventional restaurant. Very up scale and trendy appearance and leaning towards a more fancy night-life drinks crowd rather than a dining experience.
Service: Very professional and attentive. 
Food: Very very good. Some really stand-out dishes included the duck tinker kebab appetizer (wonderfully seasoned skewers cooked to perfection). We also tried the tandoori smaller and the cauliflower/broccoli. Not so sure about the latter but the meat dish was superb. 
Price: Not a place you'll be visiting on a regular basis unless you have a good income, but worth it for a special occasion.
In short - I'd really like to have the funds to be able to go back and work my way through the menu - if it's anything like my first experience it would be worth the investment.
author: Geoff A.

description: Great ambiance, great service, absolutely delicious menu.
author: David S.

description: Sometimes I don't understand how this amazing spot was a hop, skip and jump away from my house and I just never went! Thanks to my friend and fellow yelper, Leslie, I went for a double date night and was FLOORED. The ambience, service, food, everything was awesome. We ordered a bunch of things of the menu- Chicken Tikka Masala, Rogan Gosht, Baingan Bharta, Mili Juli Sabjee, the piping hot tea and Gulaab Jamun, Gajar Halwa and moong halwa- each and every dish was on point. It definitely reminded me of the hotels in Mumbai/ Delhi lanes that you learn about from locals. Very clean, in fact the plates even came out piping hot, which really was a nice touch. I am definitely a fan and will be hopping, skipping and jumping there more often than my waist-line would like. LOL
author: Shruti D.

description: The best Indian restaurant I've been too!  This is the gold standard.  Great for a date or business meeting.  Good upscale ambiance!
author: Avik G.

description:
Made a mistake of going for lunch buffet on Thanks-giving day. Very expensive buffet and really bad service. They added 15% tip in the bill itself for a group of 2 people.   
We had to ask the server for "Nan" again and again as we were waiting with our dishes full of curries for long time. 
Ridiculously overpriced buffet with really bad service. Not worth the price.
author: A K.

description:
Amber India is a real treat for the senses! Where a lot of Indian is heavy handed and just plain heavy 
The Chefs here must be "Masters" We started with unbelievably light flakey crusted Samosas. We moved to outstanding Rack of Lamb (yes please can we get another?) so rich and every bite heaven!! The Salmon was firm yet moist and buttery -no heavy spices used or needed -just fresh and well seasoned. The Lamb Vindaloo has a slow warming heat that's masterful , we loved the Garlic Naan so much -we ordered it 4 times!!
A table fav was the Chicken Rice Biriani with a delightful pastry crusted baked top!! We gorged too much for dessert -I'm sure they're sweet surrender too!! The wait staff really know their way around the menu -and they're "Hot" too
I told you -a Delight for all your Senses!!
author: Linda T.

description: Food was really good.  Service was efficient. I'm not from SF so maybe people are just rude in general (although I've never heard of this) but I found it mildly amusing that the bartender/server was super friendly, smiley, and attentive to the middle-aged, white male in a suit & tie versus me or the average looking couple sitting at the table next to me.  She could NOT have expressed any more how annoyed she was that she had to wait on either of us three. No hi, no thank you, not even a "here you go" when leaving the check.  We had a good chuckle about that. "Know your clientele" I guess. HAH!
author: Longorious L.

description: I loved the food, environment, and restaurant decor! I ordered the butter chicken, basmati rice, garlic naan, and mango lassi and it was delicious and tasted very authentic. The only thing I didn't like was how expensive the food was and how you have to order the basmati rice separately but other than that I had a great time at this high-end place!
author: Raveena S.

description:
My girlfriend and I came here with another couple; all four of us came from out of town and were meeting up in San Francisco for dinner (walk-in, did not have time to make a reservation) on a Sunday around 6:30pm.

The wait without a reservation was not very long - about 15 minutes. The place was fairly full with most tables taken (though the bar area was mostly empty). Service from the wait staff seemed a bit inconsistent - some of the staff were a bit rushed and impatient with us, but the rest were attentive and courteous (at one point, we ordered a pot of chai that we didn't finish and it went cold; they actually gave us another full pot of chai free of charge!), so I'll call it "mostly positive".

We ordered 5 things:
- Crispy potato turnovers: a bit dry, not particularly well-seasoned, the sauces were a must to wash it down. Not impressed.
- A chaat with mini samosas and sev and other things (whose name I forgot): we all thought it was excellent, full of flavor, the tang from the tamarind and yogurt, the heat, the refreshing cilantro, it was a well-executed chaat.
- Gosht karma pulao: though I'm not knowledgeable enough about Indian cuisine to say if it was a pulao or a biryani, suffice to say it was delicious - the lamb was tender, the rice was well-seasoned, the accompanying raita did not miss a beat. The portion was huge, too!
- Saag paneer: I didn't understand why there were halved cherry tomatoes in the dish, but man! It was probably the creamiest saag I've had (maybe that's what's special about this so-called "Watsonville" spinach?). According to my girlfriend, it has some hing/asafoetida in it as well, which I think added a nice earthy flavor at the base (we don't use hing at home, which I will look into changing). It was met with high approval all around the table and was the only thing we completely finished at the table that night.
- Dal tadka: seems to be what you'd expect from dal tadka... again, the hing did add a nice undertone of a flavor, but it was pretty standard otherwise.

Actually, we ordered more than 5 things: the rice had to be ordered separately. Paying $4.25 for a bowl of rice, if you ask me, is a bit of a rip off, especially when a dal tadka already costs $18. I guess you pay for the ambiance and the location in the Financial District...

Overall, we thought the food was quite good with almost everything meeting or slightly exceeding our expectations, the service was very good, and the vibe was great - lively but classy. My only complaints would be the somewhat inconsistent service from different waiters/waitresses and overall somewhat high price for the food, but given the location, it is mostly understandable - but, seriously, include the rice in your dishes!
author: Lei F.

description:
Amazing! The malabari shrimp appetizer is delicious, I couldn't get enough! We had the hot and spicy lamb loin which is actually not spicy but it was cooked to perfection, nice and red on the inside. It's also served with plenty of vegetables - fried spinach which was breaded with something and green beans. We also had the sea bass with mango curry. It was the best curry I've ever had. The sea bass was slightly overcooked but when it's served like that, it's difficult to get it less dry and more tender. 

I would be willing to bet on any dish in this restaurant. The service was great, our server was honest with her recommendations and patient when I was indecisive. I would love to come back here but it's on the pricey side so it's more of a special occasion kind of place.

The ambiance was ok, great for a date night. We were in a partial booth and we were super close to another table but overall it was a good experience.
author: Jess A.

description: While eating dinner tonight at Amber India I found hair in the Saag Paneer curry. Once we discovered, we quit eating, appetite was lost and it was time to go. Manger made us pay for our meal. We will not go back to dine there and I would suggest if you go, be careful. I should have checked there health review first, that's my fault. Be careful.
author: Bill C.

description:
If you're looking for a nice upscale indian restaurant, this is it. The food was fantastic, ambience was great, service was superb. 

Food: Palak Chaat, Saag paneer, kadhi paneer, mushroom vegetarian (i don't remember the name), tandoori chicken, butter chicken, naan, rice, roti. I was told the palak chaat was delicious. Both paneer dishes were fantastic. Good level of spice, I should've ordered a little spicier and the flavor was excellent. The tandoori chicken was very tender and perfectly cooked. The butter chicken was also great, very tender, and the curry was delicious. Only complaint I have (-1 star) is that rice is extra and most indian restaurants, the entrees come with rice. 
Also our waitress was very accommodating with our food allergies and checked ingredients with the chefs for us. 

The restaurant was crowded on a saturday night but the noise level was actually great. Good amount of space between the tables so it didn't feel like we were having dinner with our neighbors.
author: Lisa D.

description:
Cancel that trip to Bombay.  This place does Indian better than India.  Like a great recipe, follow these simple instructions and you'll feel more peace and love than Gandhi ever experienced:

Order the garlic and chive naan, saag paneer, saffron rice, raita, and the magical Amber Signature Butter Chicken.   Place a piece of naan across your palm, and with a serving spoon drizzle small amounts of each key ingredient of what you have now created as an Indian taco from heaven.  Fold and take your first bite.   Once the moaning and groaning stops, order another basket of naan. 
 
              

is sain phraansisko men bhaarateey bhojan ke lie jaane ke lie ek hee jagah hai
author: Eric T.

description:
The food was good and ambiance was great. 
A perfect Friday night dinner!
We had Kadhai paneer and Naan, it was perfectly cooked and served. 
Would definitely recommend!
author: Ishita C.

description: Excellent food, loved it... from east coast NJ ... this place is higher standard.. will come back again with family and friends when I come back...
author: Mani T.

description:
Terrific decor and dining experience.  Do not expect exact replications of traditional and authentic indian food, but expect some extremely delicious alterations and takes on the original flavors.

Cocktails are on point, and something that stood out to me was the fried calamari.  Butter chicken was also a hit.
author: John H.

description: This place is my go to place for Indian food whenever I am in SF Bay Area. The food never disappoints and service is superb. Love their palak chat, kebabs and butter chicken. The place can get loud during dinner times. My only suggestion - desserts need to have more options.
author: Lohit S.

description: Great place for Indian at the bar.  Bindhi Jaupuri and multi-grain roti was delicious.  Good drink specials and super friendly staff!!
author: Sean C.

description: Food is solid. Service is classy. Of course, it's gonna cost a premium for high-end indian restaurant.
author: E. O.

description: Food is not bad but the place is so overhyped and not worth the money at all. It's pretty expensive. For a not so big meal ( 1 starter and 2 entrees plus some naan) expect to spend 100+ dollars. There are better places for this price.
author: Jaspreet S.

description: Didn't like this place though it came highly recommended. Oily food. Overpriced. Sigh.
author: Sharanya N.

description:
My rating is actually 3.5 stars for the bar (food & drinks).

A friend and I stopped by for a quick drink one afternoon and decided to get some snacks. After reading some of Yelp reviews, we decided to get the Palak Chaat. This was soooooo good!!! We are both Indian so we were skeptical about this dish, but it definitely did not disappoint! It was so delicious that we were tempted to go back the next day just for this, lol. 

The other items we ordered were not as memorable. We got the Lamb Chops w/Rose Chutney and the Samosas. Both were just average. 

If you eat here, get the Palak Chaat!

Drinks were good. Service was good.
author: Nikita P.

description: We didn't even have the opportunity to get food based service. We walked in, where only buffet option was available and was told there was a 25 min wait. WE asked if we can sit in the lounge (after another couple came in after us was politely told they could sit there to wait). Wait staff told us our table for 4 was ready, we got up to follow only to be told it wasn't ours. The couple (who asked for table for 7) was told the table was for them (couple who came after us). Let me say, gentleman at the front greeting guests was dismissive and just seemed he didn't care to have us dine there. We did end up at North India Restaurant (2nd and Mission), and the food and service were beyond 5 stars. Amber treated us pretty unfairly, and I rarely write reviews. If you are looking for yummy Indian food and decent service, don't go here.
author: Purnima V.

description:
This is a fancypants Indian buffet. Yes, you can get other good tasting Indian food nearby for a cheaper price, but you are really paying for a nice atmosphere in here. I keep Amber India on my list for fancier work lunches or as a nice place to take out of towners. 

LUNCH BUFFET -- i've come here before for a team lunch. You can call ahead to reserve a table, or if you arrive right when they open (11:30am) you will most likely get a spot. I would advise arriving early anyways to at least get the chance to try out all the food before the lines get super long. All of their curries are delicious and their tandoori meats are very well roasted. The tandoori chicken and the meat in the chicken tikka masala are very moist. I also enjoy that they offer the sea bass during lunch time -- one of my favorite dishes here! If you want a cold drink, get a nice refreshing mango lassi. 

The SERVICE is very friendly and efficient. Our waters were constantly refilled and the waiter continuously cleared the plates off our table. 

We've also done CATERING before and had food delivered to our office for lunch. The food arrived on time and still tasted pretty good for to-go food (although our office is about 10 mins away). 

Amber India is a splurge restaurant for me, but it offers delicious Indian food with a nice ambiance.
author: Bonnie Z.

description:
This was our first time dining at this restaurant for dinner, but it definitely won't be the last.  The atmosphere is warm and inviting, the prices are fair for San Francisco, and the location is ideal for walking or getting dropped  off.  The place is very busy, so making a reservation would be ideal.

If you are not sure what to order, start with the Tandoori Sampler.  Additionally the various types of Naan are outstanding, and the March Salon and Chicken Biryani  are great entrees to share. We tried two of the desserts, and although fairly tasty, we would not recommend the desserts.
author: Ann V.

description:
Upscale Indian restaurant had its edgy and sophisticated decor. You wouldn't expect Amber to be an Indian restaurant and I will say it's definitely not your typical hole-in-the-wall Indian spot. It's walking distance to a lot of decent bars, hotels and other restaurants. We only waited about 5 minutes to get seated for two, pretty typical for a Monday night.

The service could have been better, actually let me say, A LOT better. It took about 10 minutes to have our server arrive at our table and just seemed too rushed. I hate the feeling of being rushed, especially at a restaurant where you're trying to relax and dine in peace.

PET PEEVE ALERT: After receiving our food, he came back to our table to fill our waters and, without hesitation, started asking the party NEXT to us how their food was without bothering to question anything about our food. I don't know server etiquette but I can only imagine that being a major fail.

As for the food, my friend ordered the Lahsooni Calamari appetizer with normal naan bread (best naan out there, the simpler the better.) I ordered the Saag Paneer which is always my main dish at ANY Indian restaurant. It was delicious and wouldn't have wanted it any other way. I asked for it spicy and didn't come out too spicy, but that's ok- I always ensure I do it with extra chilies or their amazing sauces.

Overall, the food was delish along with the beautiful restaurant decor, which is the only reason why I am giving them 3 stars. I'll probably come back for the food but definitely not for the real mediocre service.
author: Alessandra P.

description:
Food here is exceptionally great! We tried their chicken butter and lamb corma with a side of rice and naan. 

I have never had such a tasty chicken dish and of course that has to be their signature item. The lamb was great as well but I think the chicken wins  
The naan is fresh but small. It's enough for one person. Same deal with the rice. 


Overall: 

The food is absolutely tasty but the portions are very small. 
Please keep in mind that the rice doesn't come with the dish and that you have to order it separately.  ($5). 

They have other bread and rice variations on the menu.
author: Ghazal P.

description: Lamb was tough. Curries were mediocre. Not many gluten free options. Service was spotty. Initial service was good. But we needed to be moved as the appetizers arrived because the table next to us felt compelled to share their female conquests in graphic detail so our children could hear. The waiter was very nice about moving us. Our new waiter proceeded to ignore us for 30 minutes and seemed disinterested after that. Also disappointing that the happy hour deals are not available in the dining room (the woman seating us seemed offended when I asked). Every meal we ate in San Francisco was outstanding - except for this one.
author: Richard P.

description: I have been a repeat offender at this place. Beyond doubt one of the best Indian esp. Vegeterian food in the Financial district. Tried the buffet a couple of times and dishes from the menu. Every time came back eating way more than I had intended to. Real authentic flavors and preperation. Great service and choice of drinks. Book in advance.
author: Sumeet S.

description:
Be warned, if you have any dietary restrictions, especially life-threatening allergies, I would think twice about eating here.

I was looking for dinner on a Wednesday night before my red-eye flight that night, and Indian is one of my favorite cuisines. Amber India is under a 10 min walk from the Westin St. Francis, where I was staying, so it seemed like a good option. I called ahead and asked if they offer vegan options, and I was told they had many and others could be made vegan. Their menu items looked pricey, so I was expecting to get what I would be paying for.

What went well:
- The hostess held my suitcase at the entrance of the restaurant during my meal, so I didn't have to carry it up or down stairs to my table.
- My waiter offered an off-menu, vegan yellow dal as an option, which I happily chose as many entree.
 
What didn't go so well:
- The booth I was sitting in was too low for the table, and I felt like my arms were uncomfortably high to eat any of my food.
- My appetizer order was taken by a man I later found out was the manager, and a short while later, my waiter came by to ask if I was ready to order. Seemed a little disorganized, and I had to ask him to check on my samosa order to make sure it had been placed.
- When I was looking at the entree menu, I had many questions about what contained dairy and what didn't. I specified that I have a dairy intolerance to make sure they were taking me seriously. There was a lot of checking with other employees, but no one seemed clear on the ingredients. This lack of knowledge was even more disturbing, considering I later looked closely at some of the symbols next to menu items and realized the vegan items were clearly marked. 
- Based on the phone call I had made, I thought that there were many options and sauces could be modified, but it seemed like neither was the case. There were a couple menu items I could choose, but especially none of the vegan entree items seemed appetizing until I was offered the off-menu entree. I was disappointed that the employee who took my call had misleading answers.
- Rice doesn't come with your entree, and the entrees aren't exactly cheap. I ended up ordering saffron rice for $4.25, expecting rice that should have been served yellow, and it looked suspiciously like plain white basmati rice when it came.
- I ordered a wheat roti (marked vegan), and they brought me what was unmistakably naan (not marked vegan). I checked with my waiter, and he confirmed that the naan is fine. After the third piece, I realized there was a clear butter smell and taste that I hadn't paid attention to. I checked again with the waiter, who finally went into the kitchen and came back to tell me it had been brushed with butter. (To add to this, I read on another Yelp review that the naan also contains eggs, which I don't eat.) I made it clear that I was upset that my questions and requests weren't taken seriously, and both the waiter and manager apologized to me and seemed to take my advice on how to improve very seriously.

To try to fix the awkward situation with the dairy mix-up, I was brought a complimentary dessert of two scoops of mango sorbet, which I really appreciated. However, I had such a stomachache later from the dairy that this whole dinner really left a bad impression on me. What I would have expected after specifying my dairy intolerance and then still being served dairy via the naan (which I hadn't even ordered in the first place) would be - at the very least - getting the bread for free. I was worried about the cost coming out of the waiter's paycheck, but if I hadn't been planning on expensing this dinner, I would have argued for it. 

My meal total came out to $40.84, including the ginger beer ($4.00), samosas  ($8.95), yellow daal ($14.95), saffron rice ($4.25), and classic naan ($3.95). For a restaurant that's trying to come off as classier, I would have expected much better service--instead Amber India is just a wolf in sheep's clothing.

1.5 stars
author: Biota M.

description:
This place is outright racist. If you happen to originate from the same region of the world as this place, they will by default add 15% gratuity to your check. Even if you are party of 2 people! 

No! This was not an error or an accident, it has happened multiple times!

They are absolute disgrace to people and heritage they represent.
author: Rajiv T.

description:
First time at Amber on our first evening of a weeklong trip to SF.  We happened by it when looking for Dela Rosa next door, and decided Indian sounded better than Italian for the way we were feeling.

Glad we went!  Excellent velvet butter chicken (one of the best I have had in recent memory), and really good naan and samosas as well.  Velvet butter chicken can be overhyped in a lot of places, and I order it in almost every Indian restaurant I try, but Amber really had a wonderful spice mix to go along with rich, creamy sauce.  I would happily eat that dish at Amber once a week if I lived in SF.

My wife and I split those dishes (1 order of samosas, 1 order of naan, 1 order of the chicken over rice) and we were slightly past full when we left.  

Ordering the gulab jam for dessert was a mistake: it was delicious, but were were way overstuffed when we left.
author: Ajit P.

description:
Close to perfection.

From high energy yet romantic ambiance to excellent service to every dish a piece of art, this restaurant has pretty much everything. 

My highly recommended dishes; palak chat, badam baingan (almond filled eggplant) accompanied with mattar naan (green pea bread).

My only advice to the chef is to add more dessert options. The current options (don't know if they ever change) aren't as outstanding as the food.
author: Nauman B.

description: I love Indian food, this place is upscale, ambience is great for a dinner date or with family, but food is 6/10. Over priced, food is mild. I was looking for that flavorful tasty, masaledar Indian food. Gave 4 star for service and ambience. Give it a try
author: Aditya C.

description: This is a great place if you've never had indian food before. It's expensive. Try Curry Up Now instead.
author: Pavan K.

description: It's a fancy Indian restaurant and love the location . We went there with co-workers for lunch buffet . The salad is really good . I love it when they put tomato there . My favorite is the butter chicken . The spice is perfect and I don't taste very buttery . Also , the chicken is big and very filling . :)
author: Isabelle L.

description:
The food were really amazing! 

I had the: 
Butter chicken 
Briyani chicken 
Garlic nan
Paneer 

This is good enough for 4 people given that the portions were huge hence it's a really good amount of food. 
Ambience was amazing with good service with very attentive servers. 

I'm Really impressed  with this restaurant and will definitely come back again!
author: Shaun L.

description: This is probably one of worst Indian restaurants I've ever eaten at.  The service is good, but the food does not taste authentic.  I wouldn't eat here again.  The curry taste like it comes out of a can.  The Tandoori was decent, but definitely forgettable.  Small portions and decent naan.  With all of the East Indian people in the bay, you have to do better than this.  I judge Indian restaurants by how many Indians are eating it.  The only Indians that were there eating the food were in large groups of other nationalities.  Judge for yourself, but I'm cool on Amber.
author: Damon S.

description:
Ordered pick up. I ordered tindori chicken with naan. It was tender and yummy. It was certainly one of the best tindori chickens I have had. Naan was great too. Service was friendly and fast. 

The restaurant also looked very elegant for dining and has a nice bar, good place to take a date, business meetings and family dinners too. 5 star to my experience.
author: Al S.

description: The food is decent but waaay overpriced.   I've been to Amber twice now and both times I've felt ripped off for the amount of food that I ordered.   During my last visited, I got a butter chicken and a sea bass curry, along with naan and rice.  The final bill was $80 after tax and tip!  Are you telling me each of the two tiny pots of curry that I ordered cost my $40?! Holy shit.  Yeah the food is pretty tasty but definitely not worth the money.
author: Mason W.

description:
Insanely expensive but it really was the best Indian food I've ever had. They can go spicy on their dishes (which is always a great indicator of authenticity) and the Chicken Tikka (dry) was some of the most delectable chicken I've ever tasted. 

I'll be back (when I can afford another trip over here)!
author: Kunal M.

description: If you're looking for good Indian food in the area, check out Little Delhi instead. Amber India is pretentious and perhaps nice to look at but doesn't deliver. We walked in at 5:45; restaurant was nearly empty, and they sat us down promptly, and then after sitting us down asked us if we would be done by 7. We said yes, as we did have to be elsewhere by 7, but it seemed like poor practice for such an upscale restaurant... and THEN we were asked again while we ordered. Our food was rushed to the table -- cold, and small servings. The $4.50 side order of roti was one roti cut into quarters and was stale and hard. And THEN we were asked again if we would be gone before 7 -- at 6:15! While eating! All in all, not a pleasant experience. Dishes were interesting but somewhat bland. Would have tasted better if not served cold with stale bread.
author: Jessica S.

description:
The food was great! The atmosphere was good too and so were the drinks.
The chicken tikka and the mango chicken! Wow!YOU HAVE TO TRY THEM!

my partner had the potato turnovers and they were good too. The shrimps in the scallops meal was outstanding!!!

The price however was crazy!
Be ready to spend over $100 for 2!
But the experience is incredible
author: Vera D.

description: Very bad service, there were only 2 table occupied, waiters did'nt care to refill water.. instead they were busy talking to each other...Naan came after 15 mins when we were half done.... that too 1 naan for 2 ppl. I had to literally stop & hand them used plates, they were not at all interested in keeping the table clean. Food was ok-ok, very less selection wrt the $20 buffet price. Will not go again !!!
author: Rachit S.

description: Disappointed with quality. High prices without providing matching food quality. Will never visit this place again for sure.
author: OmShankar T.

description: Amber serves a variety of authentic Indian dishes with a twist. Some of the dishes I'd recommend here are the palak chaat, tandoori chicken, Dal Amber, garlic naan, sea bass, and lamb chops. They also have a wonderful champagne brunch on the weekends with is served buffet style. Definitely worth the money! If you're looking for a place to grab a couple of drinks, their bar serves delicious cocktails and appetizers to make any mouth water!
author: Sahiba J.

description: Will never go here again. Manager was rude and lacks customer service skills. Very expensive for the quality served. I strongly feel the 4 star rating is manipulated.
author: Bhushan W.

description:
Wow I'm still thinking about the food here. Everything I tried was so delicious. I came here on a Saturday evening for a work event. They catered to a party of 7 of us quite efficiently although they made one or two mistakes. The white wine we ordered was supposed to be a Pinot Grigio and they came by with a Savignon blanc which they quickly corrected. We were also missing an order of rice and ended up sharing.
As this was quite a last minute event for me and I had to attend another dinner in two hours, I opted out of any appetizers and went straight to an entree. To me, the gold standard of an Indian restaurant is how well they make their tikka masala or makhani or vindaloo. So I ordered the butter chicken with much anticipation and my boss ordered the lamb curry. I quickly dug into my butter chicken which was a tandoori chicken shredded in makhani sauce. Five stars!
Towards the end I offered my boss some of my entree and in return I got to try some lamb curry. I have to say, I'm usually not very enthusiastic about lamb anything unless it's in gyro form but this dish was so amazing I'm still dreaming about it! My boss was also very enthusiastic about the butter chicken and the man knows his curry because he's from London! Asides from the naan which was about four stars I would say yeah five stars all the way! It's also in a very convenient location to the hotel we were staying at and was lovely inside. Read, business dinners or fun dates. Prices are definitely San Fran standard.
author: Jess R.

description: Local Indian resturant recommended by the hotel. Food was good but I think expensive. Service was okay  but we were never asked about how spicy we wanted the food. Thank goodness it wasn't too spicy   Samosa appetizer was good.  Had lamb korma and wife had chicken tikka which was very tender and well flavored. What struck me was how large the chicken pieces were. Definitely antibiotic fed chicken as organic, natural chicken breast would not be that large. Lamb was tender but not to many pieces.  Garlic naan was also pretty good.  Single small bowel of rice ( maybe a cup) which we shared.  Overall I thought food was good , service mediocre , but place is expensive and there are some smaller cheaper Indian restaurants nearby. Lastly there was also a small additional charge which the server told me helps to pay for staff health care.
author: Louis A.

description:
