Stopped by Amber India for some post-meeting vino on a Tuesday evening. We grabbed seats in the lounge by the bar. Amber's really pretty-- more sexy Maxim girl than high-fashion Elle-- with glowing red panels and a contemporary but warm feel.

After finishing my glass of wine, I switched gears to beer. The beer list grabbed my attention as they carry several elusive brews. I ordered the Schoncamer Festweise, a choice our server practically applauded! So he's the 'not quite a sommelier but more of a spirits specialist' guy. Wish I could remember his name...anyway, he provided a great story behind my selection. Apparently, the Schoncamer Festweise is crafted by a small German convent of nuns, of which only one is allowed to speak to outsiders. Another nun mows the barley herself! Quite a story, and my beer was delicious. I googled it and it really is a rare find... guess I'll have to make more trips to San Francisco!

Service was great until the Oracle OpenWorld suits hit the scene, making it tedious to get and close our check. But I'll be back someday to talk to that cute spirits specialist... wow, knowledge is SO attractive ;)
author: Jelena Z.

description: As a visitor to San Francisco I would highly recommend every visitor to try this restaurant. Amber India is an amazing blend of great ambience with even more amazing food. I am from India and I have obviously tried 100s of restaurants in the country but the Kadai Paneer I ate here was by far the best I have eaten. Even the lachcha paratha was so nicely cooked and subtly burnt that I cant stop praising the cook. I had to meet him. Suki, a young chef from the mainland, definitely deserved a compliment!! I would highly recommend this place!!
author: Jay S.

description:
We love to go for Indian food for lunch in the city.  The problem is the places that are good are not nice enough to take people from out of town to... the places that are nice enough to take people to... suck.  

Now I have the best of both worlds!  This place looks nice and the food is pretty darn good.  I went for the buffet this week and it is the best Indian Buffet I have had.  The food was very fresh, diverse in selection, and tasted great.

I will be back for sure.
author: John F.

description:
On a recent quick trip to SF for my friend's baby shower, she and her husband treated me to a belated birthday dinner at Amber.  The space is lovely with two levels and is much larger than one might expect.  It was very crowded on a Saturday night so a reservation is a good idea.  The portions are on the smaller side so you will probably need to order more.  Between the four of us, we had:

* ALOO PEAS SAMOSA - Four come with an order and they are small, but very good.

* IDLY MANCHURIAN - An appetizer of rice and lentil cakes tossed in a sauce with flamed onions and bell peppers.  The cakes are more like potato wedges, but I liked the flavor.

* TANDOORI STUFFED ALOO - Scooped out potatoes stuffed with spiced cottage cheese, mint and cashew nuts, which are marinated in spiced yogurt and char grilled.  Four come with an order.  Try some of the green sauce on this...yum!

* BUTTER CHICKEN - Their most popular dish of shredded Tandoori chicken in a rich tomato sauce.  Make sure you have rice to soak up the sauce!

* KASHMIRI ROGANJOSH - Lamb flavored with saffron, ginger and fennel seeds.  My friend thought she might not like this dish because of the fennel seeds but that spice was very understated.  We ended up really liking this (and I liked it a bit more than the butter chicken).

* NAAN - Of course we had to order some.  We had the regular naan and also some with garlic chive.  Their naan is not very doughy if that's how you prefer it.

As for drinks, the MASALA CHAI was good.  My friend ordered some MANGO drink with muddled MINT and it was fantastic!  Definitely have to try this...if only I could remember the name...

For dessert, we had the MANGO BRULEE, a classic crème brulee infused with mango.  Yes, the perfect end to our meal!!!
author: Carol L.

description:
Delicious! So glad I forced
Myself to walk here after a long day of
Conferencing! And yes, the butter chicken is just as good as everyone says. I've now made at least three internet recipe's on butter chicken and was just not the same :(.  Thank goodness I go to SF often!
author: Fabiola R.

description: Food is fine but the service is terrible! No one came to take our order until an hour of us coming, ON A TUESDAY NIGHT! Would not recommend if you're hungry or if you expect timely service.
author: Sana R.

description:
My group left after waiting 1 hour and 20 minutes when told 30-40 minutes. The hostess kept saying that we had 10 more minutes then we were next. Unfortunately, I never got a chance to sit because my parents thought it was too long of a wait and not worth it. 

I have eaten at other Amber India's before and the food is great!  Sadly, couldn't give this place a shot.  Waited too much too long.  

Kind of frustrating to get "10minutes more" every time"
author: Alisha Y.

description: As Usual ..loved the food here!  I had been to the Mountain View and Santana Row restaurants but this location  really takes the cake!  It is beautiful!  It is located  in  Union Square next to the Four Seasons Hotel. We were invited by a good friend & they did a custom menu for us and another nice family we had the honor  of meeting that night.  the family had flow in from mMexico & nevr had Indian Food ...let me telll you they diod not leav edisappointe d..they loved every course we were served.  They had a pre printed menu  annoucing the food selection/wine pairing as well as welcoming us to the restaurtant . All the special touches were so nice. ..it was so amzing everything... from excelleny had paired  wines, scallop with avaocado sauce , butter chicken, mint nan  to the tatsty carrot cake dessert ..they wer eall simply amazing. The staff was so attentive and very nice.   We also had the privalege of  meeting  the head chef and the owner as well...which  was a nice treat too :)
author: Izzy V.

description:
Great food in a nice atmosphere.

Started with Samosas.  Then  Nalli Vindaloo and Dal Amber.  The food was excellent.  A solid balance of traditional indian spices.  Service was great.  My only knock on the place would be the price.  $28 seemed steep for the Vindaloo.

Worth a try.
author: Steven C.

description:
I've been to Amber India twice. Once was for a Bday dinner, and the great thing about having it here is that they have a really nice, private VIP room that can accommodate about 25 guests for a private, intimate time. 

It is a really elegant Indian Cuisine that takes you to the culinary level, with a great San Francisco ambiance. This restaurant has been voted to be the best Indian for the last 11 years. The food is great because it can be light and healthy, and at the same time we can spice up the food! Though, I think there are DIVEY Indian restaurants around town that can satisfy one better for both money and quality. Most people just enjoy Amber India for it's popularity and ambiance.

But, I have to give props to the owner Vijay Bist who went to culinary school in India, trained in Swizterland, Germany and France. He has a true passion for making the perfect dish from his traditional roots which is awesome that he can give us a taste of it.
author: Sweet P.

description: Exceeded our expectations! Beautiful modern restaurant deco with superb service amazing menu and ridiculously gourmet twists on Indian food!
author: Maureen M.

description:
Great food! All the dishes were tasty and not over seasoned. The portions were a little small, so for a large group make sure to order two entrees for about every three people.

I drank the kiss of Buddha... it was tasty, but so strong that the mint was really muddled. Could have had a fresher flavor.

Overall, nice place with good decor and great service!
author: Vinitha R.

description:
I had a dinner with my boyfriend last Monday . I liked the atmosphere, seemed that restaurant is so big. A waitress  was nice and made me feel comfortable, she did not come many times to bother us. If she asked so many questions as other restaurant's server, I would be completely irritated. 
We ordered 2 appetizers but I forgot their names, and ordered 2 main dishes which are signature chicken and .... Loved that signature chicken it had a lot of sauce.
author: Nomin L.

description: The lamb shank was amazing... they bring it to your table with a huge bone sticking out of it (vegetarians beware). I tried a vegetarian chili soup that packed an incredible whallop of heat. Looking forward to going back!
author: Rachel B.

description:
Did not live up to expectations, but then I expected my food to be glittered with gold flakes, and brought out to me by little penguin waiters. Lord knows I paid enough to warrant that treatment. 

Seriously, the price is ridiculous for the small portions of food you get. I give this place 4 stars within one VERY SPECIFIC CONTEXT - DATE NIGHT. The ambiance, service, and location provide exactly the kind of environment that makes people want to make babies. Just be prepared to sell them into slavery to pay for the food. For what it's worth, the food is delicious. There's just not very much of it.

We ordered the Palak Chaat, Sea Bass Kokum Curry, and Kujoor Kofta. The Palak was very light and crispy, and the chaat went very well with it. The little cranberries really did it for me. I'm a sucker for little cranberries. The Sea Bass chunks in the curry were delicious and perfectly cooked. All 4-5 them. The same with the Kujoor Kofta (which tasted like an especially fancy and nuanced Paneer Kofta). 

So I give this 4 stars in the context of date night, when all of the factors I mentioned above must be considered and given nearly equal weight. 

BUT I give it a 3 star rating in any context where you are a) HUNGRY or b) LIKE YOUR MONEY.
author: Salman Q.

description:
Indian food broadly falls into 2 buckets. North Indian (cream, garlic, onions, lentils, potatoes, meat). 
South Indian (coconuts, sea food, rich roasted spices, ginger, crepes, steamed buns etc.) 

Amber is my favourite place for North Indian food. And, of course, they have delicious cocktails. ( Vodka with lime cordial, brings back memories!! )
author: amit s.

description:
Amber India...is a gem.  Its stylish and dimly light bar features two reddish blacklight plexiglass walls, one with spirits and the other covered with dried rafia/grass and a a variety of casual coffee tables to bar height ones dot the space, along with a beautifully light stone bar.  The space looks out onto Yerba Buena Lane.  A giant but silent flat screen tv rounds out the 4th wall.

Its daily happy hour (5:30-7) is well priced ($5+ menu) with an enticing variety of small plates and drinks, a few are enough for a light dinner. There are 2 menus-happy hour + lounge.  It's in a great location before a movie, a museum evening visit, or live shows in the Yerba Buena area.

Among my favorites:  Batata Vada (crunchy fried potato dumplings with 2 different chutneys), spicy chicken wings with bell peppers, and on the lounge menu, the naan.  We washed it down with sweet mango mojitos and various red wines.  Service was prompt, friendly, and waitstaff asked us towards the end of happy hour if we wanted anything else.  

Belly full of spiciness, we were ready for some nearby art.  Thank you.
author: Jen L.

description:
Chana masala and butter chicken. I died and went to heaven...

Won the best lunch award at work the next day!
author: Stephanie G.

description: Fantastic space, service and the food is incredible! MUST GO!!!
author: Joseph S.

description: Really good buffet, something that A LOT of Indian restaurants in this country struggle miserably to pull off, so hats off to Amber for that. A la carte is also good. Friendly service and beautiful atmosphere. This is by far the best Amber location amongst all the branches I've tried.
author: Sal K.

description: Love the food! However they need to figure out how to scale. Made a reservation for a business lunch. Never could get the main course as the line was long for buffet! Wasted $$ and felt embarrassed hosting a business lunch.
author: A J.

description: Second time we've been here: First in 2013. And yesterday evening. Consistently fantastic! This much I can attest over years of coming here haha! The food is incredible. The service warm and friendly, not rushed. Love the atmosphere. We took my parents out who love Indian and they also agreed a great place to end our tour of SF yesterday.
author: Hendrick V.

description: I will give amber 0 review. Very bad food, very bad food quality and especially I would not recommend anyone have lunch as the food spell and taste as recycle food
author: Sammy S.

description: Is a memorable restaurant for us.. We were wanting to have Indian food badly and are happy now that we went to Amber India. The staff was courteous and the restaurant was easy to find. We ordered Kadhai Paneer and really loved it, it was REALLY Indian food when compared to other places who claim themselves to be masters of Indian food. For all those who really like PROPER Indian food, try it out, you'll remember this restaurant even after you leave SFO. The restaurant should add more options in rice like Biryani, Pulav, etc. The ambience was also good.
author: Vishal K.

description:
Amber is a very nice place for a quiet dinner in an elegant setting.  There is a comfortable, but small bar that is an upscale place to meet for a cocktail.  The food is VERY good and consistent.  I've eaten here a number of times now and never had a bad meal.  The lamb curry is out of this world.  The naan flatbread is a "must have" addition to the meal (I prefer the "regular" to the "garlic" or "spiced.")  They have a number of tandoori dishes (traditional clay pot braised), but be warned, when they say spicy they mean SPICY (as in sweating hot!)  

I've always had extremely courteous service, which, while quick, I've never felt rushed.  The wine list is a little odd, featuring a number of brands that are definitely "off the beaten track," but correspondingly reasonably priced.
author: Bill M.

description: Awesome indian food. I have taken everyone here who have visited me since I moved here. Really delish food. My fav is butter chicken and daal makhani.
author: Tanvi C.

description:
5 Stars for the ambience!
4.5 stars for the pesto naan and saag panneer 
4 for the daal makhani
0 for the lacha paratha
author: Sri S.

description:
Always exceptional service and delicious food! Their Butter Chicken, Paneer Saag, Naan basket, and Mango Mojito are must try's! So much flavor in the perfect portion! Haven't found another Indian restaurant in the city that can beat it. 

Tip- be sure to make a reservation a few hours in advance since it books up quickly-the number one sign of a great restaurant !
author: Marisa K.

description:
I wish I can give it a zero star. 

The service was HORRIBLE, never come here if you need any basic politeness from the waitress.

Last Saturday night I was sitting at the lounge area since the dining tables were full. After around 10 minutes, a lady came and took our order. We waited for 5-10 minutes and there was no water coming so I waved my hands to get attention from another lady at the bar.

"Water, please" I asked her.
"You should ask nicely" She replied, quite rudely. 

Then she came with two glasses with water and basically THREW them on the table with a VERY HORRIBLE ATTITUDE. 

I went to the counter and asked the manager to come, he didn't do any shit about it. He told me the waitress is coming to apologize. NO, nothing happened ever.

He was completely ignoring what the basic service they should have.

I was very unhappy and didn't want to dine there at all so I left. They even chased out to ask me to pay for the meal I didn't even touch any single bit. 

NEVER AGAIN, MOST HORRIBLE SERVICE EVER I've experienced in my life. NO EXAGGERATION.
author: Frost L.

description: We are crazy for Indian food and try it everywhere we travel. This was disappointing and expensive. Had lamb rogan josh. Wasn't bad but arrived cold. Butter chicken was meh. We were also seated in a crappy table and told we couldn't move. Won't be back.
author: David R.

description:
This is not only my favorite Indian restaurant in San Francisco, but it might just be one of my favorite Indian restaurants of all time.

Amber does extremely well what many other Indian restaurants cannot seem to: have a great, upscale ambience with an excellent bar and efficient, friendly service. 

The menu is a bit playful yet traditional, and same goes for the signature cocktails at the bar. It can get a bit hectic when it gets busy, but for me, this is place is a must when I am in San Francisco.
author: Mohit K.

description:
The Dill Tandoori salmon was some of the best I've ever had!! The Naan however left a  bit to be desired...maybe I prefer naan that is a bit doughier. 

Also I had no problems with service, they were very polite and informative about menu. 

I would definitely like to go back!
author: Bonnie K.

description: Buffet was excellent. Chai is so delicious. A bit pricey though
author: Francis F.

description: My son got food poisoning. He was violently ill after eating the lamb. This was confirmed by his doctor. When I called the next day and talked with the restaurant manager, he was more concerned about gathering our information for his insurance than he was about my son's health. Stay away!
author: Nancy R.

description:
I want to start of by saying I absolutely hate Indian buffets, the food always tends to be oily and the quality of the food is nearly always a miss. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of food served at Amber. Each dish was more delectable than the next, for true authentic Indian food do try Amber. They had 2 stations: dosa station (the chutneys were delicious) & a veg taava station (masala veggie kabobs, grilled to order). Loved their dessert bar, nothing was overly sweet, each dessert was truly decadent (can't believe I'm using decadent for an Indian buffet dessert)
I would've loved to give them 5 stars but the set up of the buffet was chaotic, way too many people not enough room to move around (lol felt like I was on a Mumbai train ) In addition to that we had to wait 15 minutes for plates and had to keep repeatedly asking for it. Once plate gate was sorted out, the service and attention we received was exemplary. Thanks Amber for making this Mother's Day truly special for my mom.
author: claudia j.

description: Omg!!! This place is awesome! So far it's my favorite indian food in San Francisco! The food is consistently good! The flavors and consistency are perfect! The only downside is the prices... They are high, but for what you are getting in flavor it's worth the cost every now and then. If the prices were less I would be here a lot more often! Also although chicken tikka masala is not on the menu they will make it for you if you request it. Will be back for sure. For 2 people 1 appetizer and two entrees will be around $80-$100.
author: Mallory R.

description: I took my colleague to lunch and we had the buffet.  The food was good and we enjoyed ourselves.  My only complaint was that the naan took a little too long and we had to ask for it several times.  The restaurant is really nice.  The buffet is a little pricey for Indian food ($19 each) but I didn't care, since I expensed the meal.  I would go back.
author: Reggy H.

description:
Great, great tandoori chicken, the best I've ever had.
But the front staff and lounge area are nothing less than a disaster. Went 3 times over the past 18 months and witnessed total disorganization. Once, there were only 2 bartenders and no waitstaff in a full lounge. Everyone there bonded over how long the wait to order was, and how long it took to get the orders. Several people were just about to give up and leave, and a fight with one of the bartender/waiters even broke out at the next table while we waited!
author: Dennis W.

description:
Amazing place to kick off the weekend! Beautiful
And hip bar and ambiance. very good service, and the food was tasty. although it is not the best Indian food I' e ever had as well that it is somewhat pricey, it is definitely worth giving a try.
author: Anne N.

description:
This restaurant looks gorgeous just by walking by it. I decided to give it a try just because of it's classy and sexy ambiance, and I was completely satisfied after my visit! I made reservations for my boyfriend's birthday and was pleased to be seated at a beautiful booth (which btw was super comfy!). I'm one of those people who gets irritated when I get seated at a random table at an upscale restaurant, so this was a big plus for me! 

Aside from the ambiance, the food was soooo delicious! The spices in the curries made my taste buds go crazy, and the lamb was cooked perfectly and falling off the bone. I wish I could come here more often, but it's a bit pricey for a college student. It's easy to rack up a large bill especially since you have to order naan, rice, and all other sides separately. I ended up spending over $100 for a party of two, but my boyfriend and I were both happy so that's all that really matters to me. Definitely want to come back during happy hour!
author: Kayla I.

description:
As an Indian myself, this place was fantastic! 

I loved how each dish was not overwhelmingly doused in gravy. For example, the spinach and cranberry kofta, were delicately placed in it's gravy, rather than mixed into it. Also, same with the eggplant. The gravy was spooned on top, allowing a balance of flavors. The garnishing of the dishes with almonds made them seem very gourmet, as they were, and the presentation was surprisingly good for an Indian restaurant. 

The decor was also great, adding to the experience. 

The only thing that would keep me from coming again, is the price, but that is typical for a place in the city! Definitely try this place out!
author: Tanya A.

description:
Rarely do I give out one star reviews.  The food here is mediocre and excessively overpriced.  I have had much better Indian food for way cheaper.

This place charged our party of six over $200 for Indian food.  We didn't even have that many drinks.  

The Chai tea was not so great and service is very slow and unattentive.


Not impressed with quality or taste.  I rather go to a family owned place that serves REAL Indian food.

I am serious!  Don't go there.  For the amount of money we spent, I rather go to Jeanty Jacks'.  Yes it's in a trendy spot and the bar looks dazzling but I wouldn't eat here again.  The butter chicken wasn't that great, I can make better ones at home using the box mix from Whole Foods..  Thumbs down!
author: Joanne L.

description:
Note: This review is for the bar area only.

Amber India's bar at happy hour is not for the timid or claustrophobic. My brother and I walked in, looked at the crowd, and almost gave up before we had even started.

Fortunately we were there for an event organized by Yelp's own Dennis A., so a space had been reserved for us. The only hard part was slowly squeezing out the interlopers.

For such a beautiful space I expected the drinks to be pricey, so I was surprised to see how reasonable they were even before the happy hour discount. Don't let the fancy surroundings fool you...you can afford to drink here.

That said, in all honesty, I would not attempt happy hour here again. HOWEVER, come 8:30 or so, the crowd thinned out substantially and the bar became an almost entirely different place...one that I didn't want to leave; the compact room size that had made happy hour so tight now made us feel like we were in someone's comfy living room. The wall of windows looking out onto Yerba Buena Lane made a nice backdrop against the cozily-lit room.

Long story short, if you want a laid-back but spiffy (in other words, non-divey) place for cocktails, give Amber India a shot...AFTER 8 p.m.!
author: Valeria R.

description:
I've been to Amber for couple of times at San Francisco location. I have always got best quality buffet food there. I am a veggie person so I will say that best Indian veggie food that I can have in city of San Francisco. I also got reviews from my meat lover friends about their Butter Chicken and Lamb dishes. I am adding it in a review for both Veggie lovers and Meat lovers.

Their service, reservations, cleanness, food quality...making it short, you name a quality that any restaurant should have, that Amber India has.
author: Sawan P.

description:
What a disappointment!  Surrounded by authentic, cozy, moderately - priced Indian restaurants, only  naive tourists  (like my group) would end up here. 
The decor resembled a Marriott dining room - the absence of any decorative nod to the cuisine served left us baffled.  The bathrooms were reminiscent of an airport - no character, again - why the antiseptic, dull appearance?
The mixed bread basket was AWFUL - all tasted the same, no stuffed Paratha  or any semblance of variety, except for the fact that all was hot, par-cooked and  re-heated at the last minute.
The Scallops & Shrimp dish , incorrectly listed under Curry Pots was so heavily dusted with cayenne powder that I left it all, minus one piece. The waiter didn't react at all when I told him I could not eat it. This was after I had  requested that the dish be "Not hot".
The Chicken Saag had very little chicken, but an ample glop of spinach instead. The Aloo Gobi was OK.  The good part of the evening was that the homeless man outside the restaurant accepted our leftover bags with a big smile.
author: Grace M.

description:
Used to come here a lot for happy hour and enjoyed every single one of them. What I really like about this place is the atmosphere. Feels like you're in the meat packing district in NYC. The decor is really chic and the staff is really nice. The light behind the bar is really cool I think. The place is huge as it stretches most of Yerba Buena Ln. 

I ate here once and thought the food was great. A lil pricey but it was good. The butter chicken is where it's at. I also tried their Tiki Masala (yeah I know plain right) and thought it was OK. I would just stick to coming here for the happy hour. The crowd consist mainly of tourist and the occasional work crowd. It makes a great place to get a drink after shopping. The location is great since the Muni/BART station is right outside the place. Overall this is a great place to experience at least once.
author: Javier G.

description:
After this past weekend's DYL Happy Hour at Amber India, I had to add another star for the killer drinks, the beautiful lounge and the after work crowd. 

The lounge is beautiful, bright colorful lighted art pieces on the wall brighten the slightly dimmed lounge area off the front of the restaurant. Different styles of seating areas allow for small or larger groups to get together and have conversations over appetizers and delicious cocktails.

Speaking of cocktails, I absolutely adore the Indian Summer. A tasty vodka drink with refreshing cucumber and one other flavor - I can't seem to remember but yet I wont forget.

The crowd was professional yet fun, an after work mix of people having a good time. This is the type of place you can bring a client to, stop in on your way to a show or movie, wine and dine your date or get together with friends after work.
author: Rebekah T.

description: Excellent lunch buffet! Went there today, was impressed with food quality, variety and presentation. Hands down best Indian food buffet experience with food that was flavorful and fresh. Will definitely return, this place fills up fast so reservations are recommended.
author: Asad J.

description: The menu options at this restaurant are very limited, for example they do not have chicken tikka Masala on the menu. They also have only one Chardonnay option by the glass which was God awful. The "sommelier" came over to offer a cheep wine from happy hour menu upstairs as a second option saying she refused to open any other Chardonnays that were available by the bottle. She said she offered only one Chardonnay by the glass so that people will experience a variety of wine?!?? That makes no sense. The food was just ok, definitely NOT worth the price. The server was nice but the "sommelier" who knows nothing about wine was rude and unaccommodating. Do not recommend.
author: Ash C.

description: I've always liked this little cluster of restaurants in the Yerba Buena area because it seems a bit more serene from the hustle of market street and is quite nice overall. I stopped in after work with a friend as we both heard great reviews of Amber. As it is an Indian restaurant, the strong Indian spice smell immediately wafted in your face. The restaurant had nice decor and was a bit dimly lit so it would make for a great date spot. My friend and I started off with an order of the naan. It was quite good as isn't wasn't too oily and was a good accompaniment to the sauces in our entrees. We got a curry lamb dish and a curry chicken dish which were both excellent. The portions were really generous too as we had leftovers to go.  Other than a lingering smell on our clothes after the dinner, the overall food and experience were great.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
My experience here was amazing. The restaurant is beautifully decorated and very romantic. The service was welcoming and the food was delicious. We ordered the samosas, garlic nan, an eggplant dish, paneer, and chai tea and a cheese dish for dessert. Everything hit the spot after a long day in the City, but I have to say, definitely try the eggplant if you're a fan of that delicious vegetable.

I would've given the restaurant a 5, but I felt that it was all a bit pricey for Indian food. But all in all, great choice for some non-traditional Indian cuisine.
author: Stephanie-Ann Z.

description:
Amber is one of my favorite places.  They have 3 locations -- Santana Row (San Jose), Mountain View and San Francisco.  This was my second time at the San Francisco location.  They were up front about what they could make to meet my diet requirements (and I wasn't surprised since I used to eat fairly regularly at the Santana Row location).  Food was good, ambience was good (if not great) and service was good.  Their Ras Malai dessert is among the best I've had in the US.

Update 6/9/17

I have since been there many, many times.  Quality and service have been consistently good.  On this visit, I discovered they have a dedicated Jain menu which lists all items that they offer without onions or garlic (and also no eggs).  For some reason, even though I took a photo of the menu, it does not show with my review.  But here's the menu:
https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/amber-india-san-francisco-3?select=C9UtvNz30cxvVvEL6nJEKQ
author: Anoop G.

description: Came here with my family when I was visiting. Very nice ambience. The palak chaat was amazing as others have mentioned. My family and I enjoyed all of our entrees wish they had a location our here in NYC.!
author: Nidhi M.

description:
* terrible service
* poor food quality, especially for the price
* decent ambiance and decor

We ordered 3 dishes, a beer, and a pot of tea. 30 minutes later, the waiter returns to say he forgot our drink order. We fill him back in and then, given his scatterbrained behavior, start to worry... "did you remember our food order?" we ask.

"Yes, yes, of course, I did!" ... then the saccharine smile on his face turned to a question mark

"wait ... you had how many dishes?" 


*sigh.* Ok, these are first world problems. 

40 minutes after sitting, we finally get our order and have the pleasure of eating average Indian food at $25 a plate price points. The sea bass was over cooked and dry, the mixed vegetable dish had spongey mushrooms no redeeming flavors, the butter chicken delivered on cream, but again was extremely dry. 

I'll skip to the end. As a mea culpa, our waiter took the rice off our bill. The rice.  ~$0.50 of real world value.

We asked to speak to his manager. He was the manager.

I will not eat here again.
author: rahmin s.

description: We came here for the lunch buffet after a visit to MOMA and I have had a lot of indian food, so this place was just okay. The price wasn't bad for the amount of food and they had a lot of things you could order for them to make fresh. The meal comes with a free mimosa and it was really highly rated. Overall, I enjoyed the food, but with all the delicious things you can eat, I don't know if I would go here again.
author: Julianne Z.

description:
It's a little dark in Amber India -- visually, not thematically or existentially. I liked it.

For a Saturday evening, I was surprised at how easy it was to find a table for three (not the best number for seating) --- which isn't to say the place was empty (it wasn't).

Our server was helpful and informative, totally willing to answer questions about dishes that we hadn't seen or heard of before. I got the four-chili sea bass, and my compatriots got their own things. The sea bass was *so good*; spicy and buttery tasting and flaking just like well-prepared fish ought to.

I saw another review that said the portions were small, and I'll agree that they're on the smaller side; if you come in starving you won't leave sated.

I will say, however, that the naan was merely average. We tried three varieties: plain, cheese, and pesto; don't bother with the cheese or pesto varieties. More money for not a lot more flavor.
author: Haak S.

description: Really some of the best Indian Cuisine that you can have in the city. What really sets this restaurant over the top however, is their excellent service and overall dining atmosphere. You will pay a little more here but you will not be disappointed.
author: Anton W.

description:
Venue 3/5
Service 5/5
Food 4/5

For an Indian buffet, pretty tasty with plenty of variety. No issues with service, as it's "serve yourself." Offerings appeared clean and well tended. Flavors were all over the map with the various marsalas! Loved the spices! 

Get in mah belly, ye curried roast po-tay-tohs!!!

We shall return.
author: Paul B.

description:
Drinks were good chai, mango lassi, sweet lassi. 
For appetizer we had Calamari, it was a disappointment, the gravy was tasty but the calamari itself tasted like it was boiled and bland.
The butter chicken was awesome.
The lamb gosh was weak.
Nans tasted fresh and tasted good.
Nice decor.

It was also pricy, yesterday we ate at another Indian restaurant a couple of blocks from here, where the food was better and cost a lot less.
author: Carl R.

description:
Best Indian restaurant... 
They make the best food it's a bit pricy but it's worth it. 
Service is excellent.. I come here at least twice a week for last 5years...
author: Jasmin P.

description: The paneer and the butter chicken were very good. The total bill was a little pricy but worth it.
author: Rick P.

description:
In a word: delicate.  Not a word I associate with Indian food normally.  Usually the flavors punch you in the face.  So much that the only meat that can stand up against the spice is lamb. 

Amber is different.  The chefs really show a delicate touch to delivering flavorful Indian foor.  

The mixed grill appetizer is classic and well executed.  The meats were well seasoned, but left you feeling surprisingly light.  The sea bass curry was fantastic.  Not only could you taste the sea bass against the spice profile of the curry, the flavors actually complimented the flavor of the fish.  Well done.

Also the fried spinach was unique in flavor as well as offering a nice crunch to add some texture to the meal.  

The scallops were amazing as were the other several dishes I had.  I think no matter what you order it is going to be good.

I had dinner with a friend that happens to be the only Indian person I know that cannot eat spicy food.  I was a little worried about what dishes we would get and how flavorful it would be.  We told the waitress that we did not want any heat and she helped us choose a huge spread of food for the table that did not have heat.  Every last one was tasty and unique.  This is a real testament to the skill of the chefs and thoughfulness of the recipes.  

Food came out hot and the service was attendtive (although a bit slow at times).

All together, this is thusfar the best Indian food I have had...Anywhere.
author: Scott C.

description: I was very impressed with everything about this place. The food was delish, and the bar was impressive. I went with two vegan friends, and we shared a salad, an appetizer, and three entrees, and left stuffed, all for about $120, tax, tip, and drinks included! I will be back.
author: David G.

description:
I got invited to lunch here today on someone else's dime.  That's always a good thing.   

Lunch is a buffet.   That can be a bad thing.

This buffet was very nice: a good thing.  Tasty food, laid out with some flair and elegance.  I didn't stuff myself, owing to a 5-hour post-lunch meeting in the offing.  (That's a very bad thing).    

The grace and serenity of the restaurant made me think that coming back here for a real meal (dinner) and ordering off the real menu (non-buffet) would be a delight.  

You're right beside the Jewish Museum and the Craft Museum.  Both would be good lead-ins or add-ons to your meal.  

Everyone at our table ordered mango lhasi which our host, an Indian, told us "does not exist in India".  Oh well...
author: Tracey A.

description: LOVE! A girlfriend and I were trying to grab happy hour at Tropisueno and of course it was completely packed so we left to go find a spot somewhere else. We popped into Amber next door and I'm so glad we did! Happy hour prices are awesome and drinks are strong, interesting, and delicious. Service is great and they are gluten-sensitive and knowledgeable. I got the palak chaat (SO good) and the lamb (one of the BEST I've ever had - amazingly flavorful, tender) off the HH menu and the portions are large! Many Indian people here (including me and my friend) so you know it's the real deal good. Also, the space is chic. We sat in the lounge/bar area and it is swanky. Perfect spot for a date or hanging out with the girls. Highly recommend happy hour.
author: Piyali F.

description:
Yes eat here you will NOT regret it!

You can order the full menu in the bar area.

I dont even remember what the food i ordered was called but let me tell you the lamb in the sauce and the other stuff i ate was sooo goood!

My gf ordered the buttered chicken and wow thats a must try! 

if you are some friends i recommend trying different dishes and share them!
Share some rise and naan bread and try each others plates like we did wich worked perfect!
author: André N.

description:
Great Indian food in an attractive setting just off Market Street on Yerba Buena Lane.  We started the evening with a cocktail in the upstairs bar. The cocktail menu is quite fun, with a variety of martini and other mixed drinks.  A red-hued fabric hangs from two walls (like framed pictures) with dramatic backlighting.

The food was great -- butter chicken, tandoori salmon, saagwala, naan.  Everything was cooked to perfection.  Service was friendly, efficient, but not overbearing.  For a first visit, this is a 4.5 star restaurant which I may indeed upgrade if our second visit matches our first.

We will definitely be returning, which means the restaurant is excellent in SF!
author: Brad B.

description: Really enjoyed my experience... Nice clean ambience and the food was delicious. I got the Chicken Tikka Masala
author: Michael B.

description: Beautiful place. Staff is "on it" and kind. Boozy drinks, in need of more balanced flavor profile. Ridiculously expensive, "Americanized" indian food. Great location, good scene, would visit again on an expense account
author: A F.

description: Try the duck tinka kebab appetizer--great in the bar.  The Tandoori Sampler was amazing!!!  Chicken perfect, shrimp perfect, duck best ever!!!
author: R J.

description:
Fantastic service at the bar. Great Indian food, in a classy setting. I would call it Indian food for a date night. Not ready to take your lady to Chutney? This is the spot for you, my friend. 

Ambiance is fantastic, food is delicious and not greasy.
author: Coco C.

description: Glad we found this little gem. A buffet with a large choice of vegetables, fried patties, chicken, goat ribs in a fantastic spicy sauce, tandoori (of course), sausages. There is also this little grill where they will propose an Umpaki (light individual pizza ) with your selection of toppings. Finally a full desert bar. On your table all you can it bread and all you can drink mimosa.the service is classy, friendly and effective. Best place for the price!
author: John F.

description:
TRUE TASTE OF INDIA!

Have been to this place a number of times and have ordered take out as well. Food is catered to American taste, service is friendly. BUT NEVER GO THERE WITHOUT RESERVATION! These folks have concept of time as punctual as a train in Uttar Pradesh (state that is home to Varanasi in India). So beware! Whether waiting there for a table or ordering delivery, take a nap and you might wake up to find yourself number 4 in line.

Lastly, prices for quantity and quality of this food are like eating in the presidential suite of Amar Vilas overlooking Taj Mahal. They are insane! 

Clearly if you have a lot of time and no care for money, please go there. It is the place for you. Cheers!!!
author: Lisa W.

description:
Not impressed by their service today at lunch buffet. For a $$$ restaurant it was pretty awful. We had to ask for everything... Can we get some naan? Can we get some drinks? Can we get the check? Etc etc.  
The food was good though. But the bad service makes it a 3/5 star restaurant.
author: Rk U.

description: Ended up here last night for a b-day dinner and i was pleasantly surprised by the romantic ambiance of amber india.  they also had a special valentines dinner menu that was pretty awesome - i had tandoori lobster which i've never had and it was a delicious way to cook the lobster.   i even liked the indian ice cream desert.
author: Wakako U.

description:
Why God oh why do you test me by putting Amber India 2 blocks away? You know of my deep unrequited love of butter, cream, and carbs - you know I can't say no when it's THAT good, and now that it's a stone's throw away, why should I even bother working out? I should just surrender to my inner fat kid because I haven't a chance.

And why do you make it so reasonably priced for a place has some of the best service in town? Why does the bathroom play Zen-like music that makes me want to stay in the bathroom? Why bother giving it such a cool refined atmosphere, when all I want to do is gluttonously stuff my face using my bare hands and lick the plate until it sparkles? And why did you make the people at Michelin so closed minded toward awesome affordable ethnic food that they can't appreciate that this is really what a 1-star Michelin should live up to, over a whole bunch of other BS stuffy French places?

I'm so screwed.
author: Snuffles B.

description:
Wow! I can't believe I missed this place for so long. It was soooo yummy. It's a little on the pricey side I suppose but totally worth it. I think I just had the best sea bass I've ever had in my life here. Cooked on the outside but tender, juicy, and flavorful on the inside with 2 wonderful sauces.

The deep fried spinach dish we had as an appetizer was amazing as was the spicy duck with a cream sauce.

I'll definitely be going back for more
author: Gregg T.

description:
Lunch buffet review:

As you walk into the SMALL door that's easily passed by, you enter notice the buffet of food...nothing special.  

I noticed way way way way too many tables crowded too closely together while being seated in the restaurant.  The food wasn't great, just mediocre buffet food.  

The service wasn't prompt and friendly, and they weren't easy on the eyes either.  Higher end restaurants usually have staff that have a certain look....there's no "look"in here...

While eating, a chinese lady to the left of me had her foot propped on a chair that was directly in my eye's view.  To the right of us was a white man seated looking directly at our table.  Very awkward eating environment.  

Sucked.  Next time I'll save myself some money and just go to Cafe Dolci and just grab a Vietnamese sandwich...
author: Janet L.

description:
MmMmMm....BUTTER CHICKEN!!!!

For months, I've been hearing rave reviews about Amber's Butter Chicken and finally I got to see what the hype was all about. 

My friend and I came here last Friday, 4.30. I made same day reservations for 1:15 PM and it took about 5 minutes to be seated. We opted for the lunch buffet ($16.95), so we can try a little of everything. 

Since I'm only familiar with typical Indian dishes like Tandoori's, Curries, Tikki Masala, Saag Paneer, Lentil Dal, and Biriyani, I can only recall a couple of dishes by name as opposed to it's traditional name. So, my apologies in advance for that.

There were about 25 items on the buffet:

SALAD/APPS TABLE:
*Apple and Goat Cheese Spinach Salad
* Papri chaat (?): Crispy fried dough wafers topped with raita and tamarid chutney 
*Veggie Fritters
*Potato Pancakes
*Tamarid Chutney
*Cranberry Raita 
*Cilantro Chutney

ENTREES:
*Butter Chicken
*Tandoori Chicken
*Tandoori Salmon
*Chili Chicken
*Lamb Curry (Green)

VEGATARIAN/SIDE-DISHES: There about 9-10, but I can only recall the following:
*Lentil Dumplings in Yellow Curry Sauce
*Cauliflower w/ Potatoes
*Lentil Dal
*Saag Paneer
*Chickpea Curry
*Basmati Rice
*Naan

DESSERT:
*Chocolate Mouse
*Rice Pudding
*Tapioca Pudding
*Fresh Fruits

I tried the following:
*Apple and Goat Cheese Spinach Salad: It was ok. The spinach was nice and crisp, and the apple and goat cheese was a nice contrast of sweet, tart, salty and savory.

*Papri Chaat: The crispy wafers was like an Indian version of chips. It was light and crisp and the raita added a creaminess while the tamarind added a sweet tang.

*Veggie Fritters w/ Broccoli: It was ok. It was room temp, so it wasn't as crisp as I expected to be. It was a little of the cakey side.

*Tamarind Chutney: Tangy and sweet which when well with the tandoori chicken and papri chaat.

*Cranberry Raita: Sweet, tangy, and creamy; although it was a little on the watery side. 

*Butter Chicken: OMFG! Believe the hype...the butter chicken is amazing! The shredded chicken pieces (white meat) was tender and flavorful from soaking in the creamy sauce. The butter sauce had a velvety tomato base with cumin, masala, and ginger notes w/ slight kick from the cayenne pepper. 

*Tandoori Chicken: It was ok. Although the meat was tender, it wasn't the traditional bright red color and wasn't well-seasoned, so you really had to use one of the chutneys for flavor. 

*Lamb Green Curry: It was good! The lamb was succulent, tender, and very moist. The green curry sauce was thick and rich and had a slight kick to it. 

*Lentil Dumplings in Yellow Curry: It was good! The lentils was more like flour dumplings b/c it was very glutinous as opposed to being grainy. The yellow curry was rich and velvety and was very mildly spiced. . 

*Basmati rice: It was ehhh. It was on the drier side and started to clump in the serving tray. 

*Naan: It was ehhh. I'm use to naan that's bubbly throughout with crisp edges. Amber's naan is thick, very doughy and not crisp; it's more like the naan you buy from the bread aisle in the grocery store.

In short, the only stand out dish was the Butter Chicken. If you're use to SPICY Indian dishes like I am, you'll be disappointed as most if not all of their dishes are mild. 

SERVICE:
It was good. All the servers were very polite and attentive, although they seemed very robotic in nature. 

AMBIANCE/DÉCOR:
Contemporary, sheek, and very earthy. The lounge/bar area has a nice lighted alkie display and yellow ottomans. The dining room is a long open space with a leaf printed ivory carpets, clean ivory walls, dark wood with red and beige accented furnishings, and a back red wall which gives brightens up the room. 

CROWD: 
FIDI workers. I did notice a handful of Indian patrons which shows that their food must be somewhat authentic b/c they wouldn't be there in the first place. 

PARKING:
Garage parking at the Metron parking lot. But, if you're coming here on the weekdays, just take Public Transportation as it's just 1/2 a block away from the Powell Street Station. 

All in all, Amber's food is 3 STARS b/c of the outstanding Butter Chicken. It is a little on the pricer side ($5 for ice tea???) and you're really paying for the ambiance. But, I'll give them an extra STAR for not getting the runs afterwards....
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Good cocktails and food was very filling. A bit pricey but ambiance made up for it. If you are out of town looking for decent Indian food, this place will be fine to try.
author: Luis M.

description: Came in with my family on Sunday for the buffet, was pleasantly  surprised as to how many buffet items they had. Great vegetarian selection for my veggie family members. Chicken tikka masala was great! Mimosas (unlimited) were included in the buffet price, my husband had champagne (also included ) . Will be returning for sure! Especially in a city when it's so hard to decide where to eat!!
author: Liketoeat14 N.

description: Nice location in the heart of SOMA. The food is consistently delicious and the staff friendly and authentic. The array of food is ideal although the attention to details given each dish is obvious and simple wonderful. Highly recommended.
author: John K.

description: Nice ambience and very good quality and spread of their lunch buffet. Every item was tastefully prepared and the buffet spread had a good variety. The only thing that the restaurant desperately needs is a physical rehaul and reorganization of the lunch buffet and tables to avoid the lines and to prevent people from surrounding your table as you eat while they wait in the buffet lines. It was quite tough to go back for a second helping and a bit awkward being stared at and listened to at your table by the buffet line folks but the food sure was very delicious.
author: Sri R.

description:
Impeccable service. 

Delicious food: no taste bud left un-tantalized. (vegetarian kofta with dates and apricots was our favorite, though we had a chicken dish with cashews that was also incredibly yummy).

Classy and upbeat atmosphere. 

Amber India is impossible not to like--the restaurant is run like a finely-tuned machine. 

Yet I must complain about something, and so I found this: I felt there was a lack of character. The food was delicious, but I think the overall experience was slightly sterile. Are they too skilled at the restaurant business for their own good? 

Many will disagree with me and I politely invite them to go to hell.
author: Emily D.

description: This review is for their catering and the catering manager Karam Gill. They came through when our other catering cancelled on us two weeks before our wedding and saved the day. Everyone raved about the food. The tasting was extremely professional and the food was amazing.
author: pav V.

description: Place was nice. Why is it when I pay $70 for a $35 to $40 meal I expect it to be much better? It wasn't same great dishes and flavor dishes in a nicer building for more money
author: Dennis H.

description: It's a bit pricey, but the food was so tasty the spices so perfectly balanced, that I didn't care.  .It's a real treat to find food as good as this, food so good it becomes a memorable experience.
author: Bob A.

description:
The Dish: I went with my good friend for an early birthday dinner. As his first time ever eating Indian food, we ordered the Butter Chicken and Pind Da Murg, both of which were absolutely heaven in the mouth. The chicken was incredibly tender and the sauce for both was flavorful. The naan was like no other naan I've ever tried - it was perfect.

Ambiance: It's a bit loud, but it's the classiest Indian restaurant I've been to. The prices are high (~$20-25/dish) but well worth it. Dine for the experience! The service is great as well. I definitely would consider coming back (I rarely frequent places).
author: Gina T.

description:
If you like Indian Cuisine, you should visit this place. If you haven't tried Indian Cuisine, start from here! 
Very quick service, pleasant decor, a nice variety of options to choose from.
After a week in the USA, my family decided to try Indian Cuisine here. We tried some of the vegetarian options - Snap peas and mushrooms,  mixed vegetables, roti and rice. Extremely happy! (And I am an Indian)
Will definitely go back the next time I visit San Francisco!
author: Lohitha D.

description: Have tried this place few times during buffet lunch. Food is awesome and good varieties for both veg and non-veg folks. Only thing is it gets crowded and the queue almost ends up near the restroom! lol  So better to be early and fill up the plate first time then regret later to stand in long queue.
author: Sameer K.

description: Great food and service. We ordered the Chicken biryani and it was some of the best I have had ever (and I have lived in Hyderabad). They don't have the veg biryani on the menu, but they will make it for you if you ask them to.
author: Neha M.

description:
Word of mouth led us to Amber India. Naturally, I Yelped it and it showed all signs of life existed on this planet so we were good to go.

When we arrived we were warmly greeted by the nice hostess. We grabbed a seat at the lounge and checked out the happy hour menu. It had about half a dozen food items offered, three cocktail drinks and a couple of beers on tap.

Shortly, we were greeted by our multitasking server (also the lounge bartender) and she took our order. I started off with a draft beer and the better half ordered a cocktail.

As I observed the crowd, the mixture of tourists, business folks and regulars seemed to be in sync with happiness. The lounge ambiance lit in sexy devilish red was pretty cool, calm and smooth...

Soon, our happy hour was served:

Batata Vada - Spiced potato dumplings encased in Gram flour batter.

Took us both by surprise! It went down the hachet like any other battered potato dish. Err so what's so special about this? Seconds later, a real nice arse spicy heat kicked-in so good...

Bhel Puri - Rice puffs tossed with onions, raw mango and chutney, topped with savory noodles. 

With each bite my brain just couldn't catch up quickly enough to comprehend all of the flavors going on in this dish! I thought this was awesome...

Bombay Spicy Chicken Wings - Spiced chicken wings tossed with onions and bell peppers. It blew her away! The perfect mixture of sweet and spicy but not to a point where you'd have to sign a waiver - it was all good! She told me, "The best wings I've ever had"! I said wow okay... It was pretty spicy delicious good!

We were about to call it quits until I looked at the back of the menu. The Lounge Menu selection looked interesting. Without hesitation I ordered the Duck Tinka Kebab - Pan fried yogurt and red chili spiced duck breast skewers served with dill and caper dipping sauce. 

So far my instincts haven't failed. The duck breast was tender, juicy and full of flavors. The yogurt mixture of sauce took this dish over the edge...

I guess the Yin and Yang must both coexist in perfect harmony to create a truly memorable experience.

I'll be back for more...
author: Gary E.

description: Come here for the lunch buffet on Saturday. They have all their best dishes available with bottomless mimosas. I would not eat for a day before because it's just that good
author: Anant A.

description:
Amber India is hands down my favorite Indian food in the world (that I have ever had the pleasure of tasting). Yes it is pricey, but it is completely worth what you are paying for. The quality, serenity of the restaurant, and overall amazing experience is worth every dollar well spent. Beautiful food, people, and atmosphere.  
The food is SO good that my boyfriend and I usually resort to ordering take out because he works from home and is always working and we live down the block on third street. (Not that the restaurant isn't AH-MAZING and well worth visiting for a special date or evening with the family or friends) ..we just enjoy our sweatpants and cuddling on the couch. 
Taj the owner is INCREDIBLE! He is a management superstar, any problems you have he will take care of ten fold over. Thank you Taj ! I adore Amber India. 
Favorite "must try's" at Amber:

Appetizers: 
Chicken Apricot kebab and English peas, portobello and goat cheese Tikki

Entrees:
Butter Chicken
Sea Bass Kokum Curry 
Nalli Lamb Vindaloo 
and for the veggies out there: Badam Bhara Baingan which is eggplant with caramelized onions amber india style is so delicious! 

Cannot forget:
*Mango Lassi* so tasty!
Saffron Pulao (rice) 
Chili Cheese Kulcha 
Garlic Chive Naan
Spinach Mint Raita 

You will not regret anything you order at Amber India. 
I could honestly eat it everyday!


I love you Amber India!!
author: Alexandra C.

description:
I went for happy hour. Had an elderflower mimosa. It was supposed to be a special twist on your typical mimosa but honestly it just tasted like I was having a glass of muscato. *shrugs* nothing spectacular.
the food was decent, but it better be for a hoity toity looking Indian spot. 
don't really know if i'd want to come back too much..
author: Susy C.

description:
Entree:  Butter Chicken -- delicious. 

Service:  Slow to greet us, but then well paced food service, and then very, very slow getting our check for some reason.

Really enjoyed the food!!
author: Sarah M.

description: Fantastic food! Not traditional but very good fusion of flavors. Fun experience as well!
author: Keith S.

description:
Good food and good atmosphere
Lots of vegan options
author: Omri E.

description:
Probably the best North Indian food I've had in NorCal (and maybe even SoCal). And take this from a North Indian.

My family has been going to Amber for as long as we've lived in the Bay Area and it's probably the only Indian restaurant we've never had issues with in terms of quality of food.  We've gotten to know the staff at the Mountain View location due to our frequent patronage and we've never had a sour experience.  Great food, and never feel guilty.

We were in SF for Fourth of July and decided we'd try the SF location, having been to Mountain View (traditional Indian) and Santana Row (more Western friendly) locations.  The SF one is sort of a bridge between the two.  Great ambiance and layout.  We arrived at 6:30 pm, were seated by 6:45 pm, had our orders in at 6:50 pm, and were eating by 7:05 pm.  Super quick service, much faster than the other locations I've been to.

Our menu:

- Garlic Naan (staple, can't go wrong)

- Mutter Kulcha (like an aloo mutter filling; superbly delicious)

- Goat Seekh Kebab (a favorite, succulent and flavorful)

- Dum da Murg (chicken is super tender, delicious)

- Baluchi Murg Tikka (different version of standard chicken tikka masala, a bit more flavor and less spice.)

- Palak Paneer (my parents are super healthy, ordered it without the cream as per my father's request but didn't miss the cream. very light and perfectly spiced. Also for an Indian restaurant, the actual amount of paneer pieces they put in the dish was much higher than regular, which is always a huge thumbs up)

- Paneer Labadar (my brother and I wanted something with more masala so we ordered this. same story of generous portions of paneer, delicious)


Suffered quite a wonderful food coma after my meal but totally worth it every time.  Yes, the food is a bit pricey but it's worth it because you know they do a phenomenal job.  Amber, you've had my seal of approval for 15 years and counting.  Whatever y'all are doing is working so keep at it. :D
author: Kunal B.

description: I've had dinner here several times but recently went to Amber for a team lunch. The buffet is varied and tasty - Butter Chicken is a must. The noise level is low enough to talk and the naan keeps on coming out piping hot and fresh.
author: Sandeep C.

description:
After attending Folsom Street Fair, I was in dire need of some vittles, stat. So I google mapped the closest India fare, and Amber India popped up.

Hesitant at first to walk the 2 miles(after an endless day of strolling), I made the trek since there was no way I could move my car in the traffic, knowing that I only had one hour before the parking garage closed.

Once I opened the paned glass door, I was greeted by three lovely hostesses who were so sweet, they even charged my phone for me. It was grand. I got seated in the front of the restaurant, let my waitress Ciara know that I was in a rush; and I ate a delicious korma with saffron-laden rice, paid the bill, and left with a charged phone in under 45 minutes! Talk about speedy, these guys are on the ball, I will definitely return on a future visit.
author: Lisa C.

description: Food is fantastic, setting and staff are great. My only concern is the portion size which is on the small size for the price. The chicken tandoori for example is twenty three bucks for one chicken breast. That's ridiculous. We spent over a hundred bucks for two with no alcohol and left hungry.
author: Marsh M.

description: My family and I went into San Francisco for the evening and decided to try Amber. BIG mistake!! My husband ordered the minced lamb dish, no sooner had he ordered the dish it arrived at our table?? I swear it had been cooked ahead if time and simply microwaved to heat. It was without a doubt the worst meat, the waitress came over and was stunned when we told her that the dish was unacceptable. Then when the bill came and it was $96.00 for two entrees no alcohol was ordered, so $96.00 for a sea bass dish and a buttered chicken plate we could not believe it, I had no problem paying that if the food was good, absolutely no problem at all but the food was not good. We did go towards the end of the evening and I do believe we were simply given the left overs. Not a smart move on the part of the restaurant.
author: Catherine G.

description:
Pretty average food. Been here on a buffet. Most of the items are cold, the lamb kebab was bad. 

Had to ask 3 waiters for a drink. Very bad service. Don't think will ever come here.
author: Sireesha A.

description: Love Amber India - great atmosphere and delicious Indian food.  I'd say it's tied with Dosa for best upscale Indian restaurant in the city.  Fees a bit pricier though.  If you want a less expensive, slightly more casual version (but still upscale) check out Masala Dosa in Inner Sunset.
author: Greg B.

description: Their service is excellent. Food taste is ok, nothing out of ordinary. Palak chaat is unique. It is a bit pricey. There are much better places for that price. However, good to try once.
author: Abhishek G.

description:
Nice little surprise while staying at the attached San Fran Marriott Marquis for a conference.  I am lucky to come from an area of the Midwest that happens to have very good Indian dining options, so I was ready to put Amber up to the challenge.  

First off, as alluded to by others, this is a swanky joint for Indian cuisine.  Lucky for me, I was there for the lunch buffet ($16.95).  I arrived before noon which helped as the dining room filled quickly.  There is a nice view of walkers-by near the Contemporary Jewish Museum and some other high-end shops.  

I started my Amber experience by ordering a chai tea which was VERY good and steaming hot.  Next up was the first trip to the buffet.  Round one consisted of Butter Chicken (signature Amber recipe, shredded Tandoori chicken in rich tomato sauce), Catfish (curried?), Bean Sprout / Baby Corn Cold Salad with Cilantro, Goat Cheese & Almond Croquettes, and a Lamb Patty (not sure what all was in this).  The Butter Chicken was hands down the best I've had and was velvety smooth and chock full of flavor (I could have started an IV drip of that sauce!)  The Catfish was very good and mellow, although I am not sure how exactly it was prepared.  This is the first time I've had catfish at an Indian restaurant.  The biggest surprise and again a first for me, was the Bean Sprout & Baby Corn Cold Salad.  It was very refreshing on an oddly hot fall day.  The cilantro was bright and an excellent contrast to the earthy flavors of the bean sprouts and the sweet, delicate flavors of the baby corn.  Since I can't leave well enough alone, I did top mine off with some mint chutney (see IV drip addiction problem above).  The Goat Cheese Croquettes were ok, but felt like something you'd get on a cruise ship.  The Lamb Patty, hmmm...I am not the biggest lamb fan, so I'll start by qualifying that point.  It just didn't taste that good to me.  "It's me not you..."  Lastly, the na'an was hot, but was not charred as I would prefer.

In summary, this is excellent Indian cuisine, albeit a bit on the pricey side.  However, the food is packaged nicely with beautiful surroundings and attentive service.  I'll definitely be back to Amber my next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Ryan P.

description:
Great location
Great interior
Nice waiting area by the bar
Friendly staff
Very delicious food. Ordered a paneer masala and naan
Drinks at the bar were good too.
Reasonably priced
author: Kinjal S.

description: Sunday Brunch!!  Outstanding!  A great departure from a traditional brunch.  All their Indian dishes in one place.  Service was perfect.  The chef was happy to explain many of the dishes to us.  Can't wait to get back.
author: Jason V.

description:
We have dined at Amber many, many times.  Our last visit was yesterday evening.  Chef Ajay is an outstanding professional who has the ability to create gourmet dishes that have consistently exceeded our expectations.  I rank Amber amongst the top 5 Indian restaurants across the globe.  Every bite created by Ajay is a burst of flavors in the mouth and truly an unforgetable experience.

The highlights of our dinner were Butter chicken, Lamb Bhuna, Dal Amber, Sea Bass and Shrimp Masala.  Needless to say all other dishes were delicious, but these stood out.  The combination of ice cream with besan burfi was a unique concept, but worked extremely well.

We look forward to returning to this world class establishment soon!
author: Jagjeet B.

description:
The Beatles say happiness is a warm gun.

Mark Twain said happiness is a Swedish sunset.

Winnie the Pooh says happiness is honey.

Whatever your definition of happiness is, I recommend you begin your search at Amber India's happy hour from 4pm to 7pm.  

A Bulleit Manhattan the size of a thermos is your's for a mere $5. There are some tasty bites, like kefta naan and samosas to counterbalance the bourbon.

By 7pm, you'll likely be infinitely happy, and your wallet will be as well. 

The happiest happy hour I have found to date.
author: Joanna M.

description: But for somewhat indifferent service, this restaurant would merit the full five stars. Truly some of the best Indian food I've ever had and indisputably the best lamb I've ever had in my life. Prices are downtown SF steep but portion size is generous enough for two . Be forewarned that when you ask for spicy they'll light you up properly...the lamb vindaloo was hot enough to induce a wonderful pepper high and I ate the whole thing since my dinner guest couldn't handle more than a spoonful...her butter chicken was the opposite of spicy, creamy and delicate. A great food experience but the service is a little slow and you'll have to occasionally flag someone down for water or a napkin.
author: Ted S.

description:
Amber India is a trendy Indian restaurant with good food, great ambience, convenient location.

Pros:
Lots of vegetarian options including chaat (Indian savory snacks) on the menu.
Mock-tails with an Indian touch
Lots of seating for large groups
Assorted bread basket
Tandoori sampler plate

Cons:
Service was slow; probably because it was packed to capacity
Rogan Josh was not impressive (I've had better)
author: Abby Z.

description: Like the lunch buffet, especially the grilled seabass dish with spices, and the eggplant & vegetable stews. I went back for seconds and had a lunch coma afterwards.
author: Rebecca C.

description: Amber is definitely my favorite restaurant in San Francisco. Although it is pricey, I always choose Amber for a special occasion. Delicious food and beautiful decor!
author: Julia P.

description: If you want to meet the worst manager, the most rude one go to Amber and make sure that you are having Mr. Ajay at your service. The way to talk either in person or in phone has been worst. and yes i`m not writing this based on one outing....i USED to visit amber once every fortnight......and now would never.....no words...destroyed the fun and enjoyment of my meal by spoiling my mood....of course we left the hotel..
author: Aniruddha K.

description:
For indian food this place was pretty good. It's not the best I've had but the decor was very very very nice.  I felt welcomed here, and everyone was very nice.  This little girl kept playing with the lights making it much lighter/darker constantly and I thought the restaurant would put a stop to that but they didn't.

It didnt bother me that much but it was definitely kind of annoying. The prices are pretty expensive but I expected it.. being in a nice part of town.
author: Toby I.

description: Food was great but portions small and the atmosphere felt very crowded, it was very loud and not at all relaxing. Probably a good place to go with a group (if you've booked a table).
author: Kira G.

description:
4 stars cos the service was poor, and we kept waiting on the waiter to order, for our bill, etc. 

Fun drinks - and Great food. Usually not a fan of lamb... but their lamb was really good and not gamey. Huge WIN.
The lentils dish was my favorite, the Paratha was super warm and fresh. Biryani was good, The cheese cube dish was super good too,and we got the butter chicken - which could have been a little better. But all in all - it was yummy.  AND nothing was too greasy, no cheap chicken meat, and actually served white chicken meat - wooo HOOO!!

coming back here soon.
author: ThuZ W.

description:
Had the lunch buffet.  18 bucks a head, come hungry, leave happy :D

Plretty cool inside, probably the best indian buffet food i've ever had.  Very clean and nice.
author: Michael E.

description:
Here's an Indian restaurant that won't leave residue on your hair and clothes smelling like you've been wrestling in Indian spices.  Great location, nearby Union Square and right off of Powell Bart Station.  There's a warm contemporary feel to Amber India.  This is an upscale Indian restaurant and so was the price.  The most expensive Indian dinner I have ever paid for.  

Crab meat appetizer, samosas, 2 orders of basmanti rice, an order of potato nan, a lamb stew, and a lentil dish.  The food wasn't bad but it wasn't outstanding enough to have a $80+ bill.  With that kind of money, I could've gotten 2 very satisfying orders of pan seared foie gras. 

A nice atmosphere if you want to host a party but I was disappointed that chicken tikki marsala wasn't on the menu.  I left hungry and unsatisfied!!!  This was a good experience but I will stick to Chutney on Jones St. where I can get a dinner for 2 for half the price and still have leftovers.
author: Hannah C.

description:
Food Quality - Excellent.
Food Taste - Good.
Food Originality - Good.
Price - Good.
Customer Service - Good.
Ambiance - Excellent. Unlike other indian restaurants.

Best Indian buffet in town. Entrees (outside of budget) are good too.

Weekend brunch also has mimosas and soft drinks included.
author: Vibhor C.

description:
The buffet is ridiculously delicious.  I left so full I needed a moment alone.  Soon after the event, I sneezed at my desk and my pants unbuttoned themselves, that's how much you can indulge at Amber India. 

The butter chicken is finger lickin' good.  Naan comes with, everything was spot on. 

$16 for buffet may be a bit on the pricey side but this place serves up some major high end indian delight realness.
author: Andrew Christian C.

description: This place is good for a lunch buffet for the price but the a-la-carte ain't that exciting. Non-authentic Indian food modified to suit majority of palates can be a tagline. However, the lounge makes a good spot to hang out with friends for some mediocre drinks.
author: Deepthi M.

description: Came to a convention at Mascone center and tried this restaurant. First, you have to reserve to get a place to eat, this never happens in San Diego in any restaurant. Ambiance was very good, they were very busy. Food tasted well, some needed more blend of spices. Naan bread good, mango lassi was to think and difficult to swallow and you cannot drink lassi through the straws they gave you. All in all, I would recommend this restaurant!
author: Carlos H.

description: I don't do Indian buffets that often but every once in a while it is necessary to gorge on some butter chicken, naan, etc. I don't think there is a better place in the Bay Area to do that than Amber. High quality ingredients and prepared properly. You won't leave with food coloring all over your hands - which often happens when going to cheap Indian buffets. It costs more than the average Indian restaurant but it is worth it bc of the above mentioned and also the classier environment.
author: Akhil K.

description:
My go to spot for good Indian food, it's worth the price.

Highlights:
Cauliflower Bezule
Butter Chicken
Ferry Market Veggie Curry
author: Andrew K.

description: There is a reason this restaurant is considered one of the top Indian restaurants in the Bay Area. While I tend to prefer the more traditional Indian fare served up in the Mountain View location, I love the slightly more contemporary fare whenever I come here. The dishes are immensely creative, one of them being the duck kebab, something you definitely don't see often at an Indian restaurant. The truth of the matte rid, while dinner is great, you can definitely come here for cocktails and some appetizers during or even not during happy hour and still leave incredibly satisfied. My family actually tends to prefer that option with this particular restaurant because of how filling Indian food is and the fact that we are most likely walking around afterwards in the city. The fact that this restaurant is near the Westfield/Union Square location makes it ideal for shoppers to stop by here for a meal in between their shopping. Their decor is also lovely, more on the contemporary side to fit with the food, and the service was impeccable. Stop by here for tasty Indian food!
author: Kunal N.

description:
The best Indian food I had so far ! This place is the epitome of what Indian food should be like - very authentic and flavorful with very nice, upscale ambiance. 

A bit pricey and can be busy, but its totally worth the money and the wait! The lunch buffet is excellent. I suggest Mango mojito and the mango pudding - both were heavenly.
author: Preet S.

description:
Buffet:
- High quality indian food (it's worth the price!) so tasty!!
- very nice ambiance 
- mango mimosa was delicious!!
- be careful of the floor, I almost slipped a few times!
author: Emily C.

description: My favorite lunch spot when I go to Moscone center for business. Probably the most variety of dishes I have seen from buffet setting. If you like spicy flavor, they have a plate of skinny raw chills you can take a bite off. Can't wait till go back.
author: Hong K.

description:
I've maintained from the very beginning that since I usually hate having Indian food outside of my house. Until I moved to SF that is. Two restaurants stand out in my mind - one is Dosa, and the other is Amber. 

In short, Amber does traditional (north) indian food incredibly well. Add a dose of upscale dining, a great downtown location, and great service and you're in for an amazing night. 

The restaurant is huge, yet at any given night, I've seen Amber nearly full, which speaks to its popularity and delicious food. So delicious that I went once 3 days in a row, absolutely unintentionally, and the waitress recognized me. 

Yes, it was slightly embarrassing. Yes, I pigged out at the awesome buffet. (They have this 7 days a week)

Alright. Cutting to the food review. The dishes I've had - 

Appetizers
1. English Peas, Portobello, & Goat Cheese Tikki - yummy patties with the aforementioned ingredients fried to delicious goodness. Give it a try!
2. Aloo Peas Samosas - good. Nothing extraordinary. It's samosas. Ok alright, it's not greasy. Thank god for little miracles.
3. Chicken Apricot Kebab - great combo of chicken and apricot! loved it.

Entrees
1. Butter Chicken - this is their signature. And they do it, very, VERY well. Go for it. 
2. Sea Bass Kokum Curry - so so great. Amazing fish dish and the coconut milk adds a ton to it.
3. Paneer Lababdar - basically take what you had in the butter chicken and remove the chicken, and add paneer. Ladies and gents, we have paneer lababdar. Good stuff.
4. Badam Bhara Baingan - OMG. Favorite dish on the menu. Hands down. Try it. Eggplant, caramelized onions, and almond PERFECTION.
5. Lahsooni Saag Paneer - your typical great saag panneer.

And of course, the tandoori rotis, the rice, the raita....all of it phenom.

Lastly, desserts - they're all pretty mediocre IMO compared to the rest of the menu. And come what may, please never try the Falooda with Strawberry ice cream. 

Go on, give it a try. It won't disappoint. It's definitely more expensive than many other indian restaurants out there, but it offers a variety that is consistently amazing with an absolutely awesome setting. 

However just in case you're still skeptical, definitely give the lunch buffet a try and try many of their different dishes for a great price. I guarantee you'll find yourself going there...perhaps more than 3 days in a row :)
author: Aditi R.

description: Very good restaurant serving high quality food. Make sure you are there atleast 2 hours before they close so that you can enjoy leisurely.
author: Suhas M.

description:
Ordered the Bharwan Aloo
(Stuffed potato barrels, spiced cottage cheese, mint and cashew nuts), Baluchi Murg Tikka (chicken) & Quinoa Subz Kofta (saucy veggies) & chili thyme naan.  Delicious!  Oh and washed it all down with a ginger beer!  Rasta!!!  Very friendly staff who didn't hesitate to provide a recommendation....
author: H H.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised because after seeing the setting and menu, I expected all hype and no delivery. However, the food was rather good. I avoided the fusion dishes and picked out the identifiable more traditional Indian dishes.

Mutter Kulcha - it's basically aloo paratha (mashed potatoes and peas) but inside naan instead of paratha (unleavened wheat bread) - 4 stars

Butter chicken - 4 stars. Lots of meat, nice tart and sweet yet rich tomato-based sauce. Lots of large chunks of chicken to make the unusual high cost more worth it.

Tandoori sampler -2 pieces each of lamb seekh kebab, chicken tikka, & shrimp - 3 stars. The chicken was the best- huge chunks of juicy, tender, smoky chicken. The lamb was underseasoned and very strong in flavor (overwhelmingly so). It was also dry and fell apart. Added some of the mint chutney they gave, and it saved the kebabs a bit.
